review_body: I've been searching many apps for taking notes for my galaxy tab and I think squid is the best apps out there. I use squid for school and all features I need is there. From drawing shapes to make table and easy way to add photos, I think upgrading to premium is a must. But the only thing that I thin...Full ReviewI've been searching many apps for taking notes for my galaxy tab and I think squid is the best apps out there. I use squid for school and all features I need is there. From drawing shapes to make table and easy way to add photos, I think upgrading to premium is a must. But the only thing that I think needs to be upgraded is the way to scroll the page is slow I don't know it's repairable or not but I dont like the way it comes out as boxy first then it becomes normal. But overall the apps is good

squid is the best option we have, period. But in some cases, it could be su much better. -utilise the s-pen as best as possible (other optimalization stuff) -let us have favourite pens and colours so we can browse trough them with the s-pen button for a much quicker switch -it sometimes feels a bit ...Full Reviewsquid is the best option we have, period. But in some cases, it could be su much better. -utilise the s-pen as best as possible (other optimalization stuff) -let us have favourite pens and colours so we can browse trough them with the s-pen button for a much quicker switch -it sometimes feels a bit off, Samsung notes gives a much better writing experience for me, idk how to put this in useful terms -overall redesign with night mode? (this just my opinion, far from a must do)

Love this app! Been using it for revision notes at university. Only one tiny thing that bothers me and it's the inability to actually swipe left and right on to different pages. You have to press arrows instead. Would highly love to have this feature added, but other than that, would 100% recommend!...Full ReviewLove this app! Been using it for revision notes at university. Only one tiny thing that bothers me and it's the inability to actually swipe left and right on to different pages. You have to press arrows instead. Would highly love to have this feature added, but other than that, would 100% recommend!!

I do like this editor. I think it has good potential. To be quite honest, the design and look of the app feels kinda old and really clunky. I feel like the app just looks kinda blah. But in top of that there's a lot of functionality, just in wrong places. You provide extremely niche templates and ru...Full ReviewI do like this editor. I think it has good potential. To be quite honest, the design and look of the app feels kinda old and really clunky. I feel like the app just looks kinda blah. But in top of that there's a lot of functionality, just in wrong places. You provide extremely niche templates and ruling. But you only provide one pen and highlighter! Very frustrating, add in some sort of calligraphy pen or something flourishy. Something to get people creative.

The best I've used for importing PDFs which you want to annotate. Fully utilizes the Google Stylus variable pressure/line thickness function. I often use Squid to make PDF presentations, and my slide advancer (Kensington with USB) does not advance "slides." I have to press the page advance <> icons ...Full ReviewThe best I've used for importing PDFs which you want to annotate. Fully utilizes the Google Stylus variable pressure/line thickness function. I often use Squid to make PDF presentations, and my slide advancer (Kensington with USB) does not advance "slides." I have to press the page advance <> icons manually. Would really appreciate the ability to fully-present without having to go to the screen to go to the next slide.

Really good app for drawing notes, brainstorming for Chrome OS. What i love most is the infinity board which allows me to just keep on drawing and brainstorm + zoom in with 2 fingers. Im on the paid version. What i would suggest to add is more friendly ways to access the tools. Its ok, but can be im...Full ReviewReally good app for drawing notes, brainstorming for Chrome OS. What i love most is the infinity board which allows me to just keep on drawing and brainstorm + zoom in with 2 fingers. Im on the paid version. What i would suggest to add is more friendly ways to access the tools. Its ok, but can be improved. Tqs!

I like this app. Probably the best for android hence I paid for the subscription. But not having sync to Google drive or One drive is one of it downfall. At least that is the most common cloud. The amount of pen type can also be improved.

The one thing I would like to see improvement in is the shape tool. The circle tool makes the circle in a box, and doesn't track right. If it was a select the center, drag to edge thing, it'd be more accurate. Also, the snap to a shape feature on Notability is super nice.
One of the best noyebook apps i have used. Tons of different options to choose from. I really liked being able to choose my paper size and type.
Good note taking app, but few modern utilities. Need a lot of quality of life additions.
Perfect app. Pricing is quite high though, if you opt for the subscription way.

I am using since 2018. I cannot share my notes in the Dropox and Drive folders I share with my students.
Two requests: 1. Add a dotted line pen. 2. I'd like a black background option. Thanks!
The best app for drawing, writing, note taking , etc. I wish Squid was available for iOS. I would pay big money for it.

This is the best note app that I have found for handwriting on a Chromebook tablet. The palm rejection is way ahead of other apps, even Google's own Google Keep, which is shocking to me. The palm rejection is way ahead of other apps, even Google's own Google Keep, which is shocking to me. What would really help it to pull ahead is a dark theme and a redesigned interface that makes quicker access to all the tools.

Honestly I really like it, it is better than a lot of the options out there. The only two problems I have with it is that I have to zoom in to max to write with the stylus I have (adonit snap) other wise it there are gaps. Also the fact that importing PDF isn't free bummer but it's okay. But writing...Full ReviewHonestly I really like it, it is better than a lot of the options out there. The only two problems I have with it is that I have to zoom in to max to write with the stylus I have (adonit snap) other wise it there are gaps. Also the fact that importing PDF isn't free bummer but it's okay. But writing experience on a PNG is kind of really sad. Over all just writing notes I really like it.
Love this app. Works great with my stylus and has been great at keeping my life organized. Thank you!!!

After using for a while, I have few suggestions/requests. Being able to save preset pen sizes and colours would be fantastic. An option to set default conditions for read-only like "fit width" or double tap to fit width, would be very useful when going back over notes and switching between writing a...Full ReviewAfter using for a while, I have few suggestions/requests. Being able to save preset pen sizes and colours would be fantastic. An option to set default conditions for read-only like "fit width" or double tap to fit width, would be very useful when going back over notes and switching between writing and reading notes in different view "modes". Finally, in read-only, being able to tap RHS of screen to go to next page and LHS to go back would be gr8.

author_name: Dr. Raul Z DC And CedarSage
review_body: It is what i imagined, it is worth it to sign up for the upgrade, there is an anual option cost, pretty affordable. Also it occurred to me that Should prefe...Full ReviewIt is what i imagined, it is worth it to sign up for the upgrade, there is an anual option cost, pretty affordable. I suggested to add some sort of files within files, since i run a travel practice and I would like to keep my notes on different clinics I run. Also it occurred to me that Should prefer to choose open the application on a specific group of folders. other than that Great job guys!! Looking forward for improvements!!
My favorite! I use this more than Microsoft. I recommend it to all my family, friend, & coworkers.

For writing and creating new documents is the best ...Full Reviewgood app for writing on a tablet. Full version is 10‚Ç¨/year. I would give 5 stars if you could directly edit pdfs. I loved this app. Seriously considered switching to this exclusively, however, there are some drawbacks. One, there isn't an option to sync to onedrive or googledrive. Huge issue for me, considering I really wanted a way to store all my notes in college. Two, I hate the organization of this app. I c...Full ReviewI loved this app. Seriously considered switching to this exclusively, however, there are some drawbacks. One, there isn't an option to sync to onedrive or googledrive. Huge issue for me, considering I really wanted a way to store all my notes in college. Two, I hate the organization of this app. I can't make folders or subfolders or color coding. Three, I hate the fact that I can't type notes as well. Sometimes I want to handwrite but other times I don't. I hope they update soon.

Snappy and feature full! My only issue with this app is the lack of cloud syncing. Backing up and restoring from cloud services does work, however it is much more complicated than some thing like one-note. This makes using Squid on multiple devices a hassle. Squid makes up for this by being the smoo...Full ReviewSnappy and feature full! My only issue with this app is the lack of cloud syncing. Backing up and restoring from cloud services does work, however it is much more complicated than some thing like one-note. This makes using Squid on multiple devices a hassle. Squid makes up for this by being the smoothest, most responsive note-taker I've used on any device! One-note for android is glitchy and all the others are slow or feature-poor. PDFs are a Breeze to write over too, great for homework!

It's so far the best note taking app I have come across. Only features it misses out is the ability to quickly insert mathematical objects (I would love to have this as a feature. eg empty matrices, greek symbols, Integral signs) and the ability to screen record with mic audio. It would then be the ...Full ReviewIt's so far the best note taking app I have come across. Only features it misses out is the ability to quickly insert mathematical objects (I would love to have this as a feature. eg empty matrices, greek symbols, Integral signs) and the ability to screen record with mic audio. It would then be the perfect whiteboard app.

Such a great app for taking college notes, it allows me to add pictures and then write a note on the side and it allows me to add whatever pdf I want on it which is cool, I also can section all my classes out so I know which notes go to what. I love it and I cant live without this app. I never have to carry a big binder again uhhh makes my back hurt thank you for ,asking such a great app!!!

The app is great but it has a few cons. I'd like to see some updates and more features considering the fact you pay a montly fee for the premium version. I'd recommend adding more text editting tools (e.g. bold, underline text) and an option for organising notebooks in different subcategories.

The tools are simplistic in design and function. Highlighting for example, doesn't allow added notes to the highlight or any bennifit beyond visiual. Functionality doesnt' exist below the surface -- like it does with every other pdf editing or markup tool I've ever used. The name Squid, suggests connections between multiple papers, and connected references. Neither of which exist. No acedemic functionality.

This app would be better on a tablet in my opinion... Even though I have a giant phone, the zoom in while writing feature was getting on my last nerve... I'll download it on my tablet and try that out next... But I don't recommend it for your phone...

Squid has helped me take my lessons online for digital learning. Hi everyone, I tried several comparable apps for handwriting. I really suffered from a lag between touching the screen and an actual response, it made handwriting almost impossible. But in Squid such a lag is not noticeable, I just set a scale to 1000% and used my laptop as a paper notepad, loosing ...Full ReviewHi everyone, I tried several comparable apps for handwriting. I really suffered from a lag between touching the screen and an actual response, it made handwriting almost impossible. But in Squid such a lag is not noticeable, I just set a scale to 1000% and used my laptop as a paper notepad, loosing only a small amount of speed (but I guess it's due to my laptop and a pen itself, but not the software) I really like this app and appreciate your work, thank you guys P. S. I miss a calender option
I love this app, If Develop can upload file on cloud.I think for the Best. Thank you!!
Great writing app. Would love to see some support for UML but love this app.

Presentation mode is mentioned everywhere in the help but not how to actually turn it on or use it. I have looked everywhere and I cannot find anything other than settings for it, which are just for enabling and automatically starting. I have no idea how to actually use it. Here is not a link.

This app is pretty nice. Somehow, scrolling seem a bit laggy and also lack some feature like copy picture from another app and paste directly into the page. I hope the development continue develop this app so that android tablet have the potential compete with ipad in the future.

It's a good app. The writing is smooth and fluid using my Stylus on Chromebook Pro. The best part is the ability to import PDF and annotate it. Have been using this for a few years now and very happy.

good but not great, It is lacking syncing across devices and I have had to reinstall it a couple time and lost all the past files I had created. The ability to use my S-Pen to write is very nice and it is very intuitive to use.

What Squid does it does really well. There are a few badly-needed tweaks which can make this program really great. One thing I miss is having a few pen presets rather having to adjust with sliders. The developer seems to be actively welcoming suggestions so I'm keeping fingers crossed.

An all-around great annotation program. I use this program to take preparatory and mid-hearing notes when I'm in court, and to annotate PDFs when I review documents. I used to use Inkredible (from memory), but Squid works infinitely more smoothly with my HP Chromebook X2.
great app for taking notes. Well worth paying the subscription to import and annotate PDFs. I only wish I could search note titles, now that I'm using it more and have lots of notes.
Simple but powerful tool for making all the meeting notes and plans forward. Paid version is definitely worth of money. Stylus response is also very good. Recommend everyone who keeps daily notes.
Exellent app, i recommend only to link it with an account so you can see same notes in all of your devices.
Just still need some minor enhancement, when attach PDF, still can't rotate after insert, the rest working fine. I love this app. Would like to know when Squid can solve this issue?
It's just another note app. I would have given it a higher rating if there was an option for a one time purchase, but it's subscription based. There needs to be folder within folder option.

This app has been such a help with university work. It allows me to have all of my notes, summaries and more with me wherever I go. It's super functional with the ability to import .pdf files and insert photos. One of the best investments I've made so far in regards to my studies.
Very useful app, but the lack of some specific features makes it not completed yet. Anyway, in my opinion, it's one of the best app to make notes using the stylus.
Love this app. I've used it around a year for school. I'd have no problem recommending the subscription version of this app. The extra features are well worth the cost, in my opinion.
Squid is very reliable program and I use it a lot for my hall lecture . The software is stable and runs very fluid on my samsung 2016 tab A. Keep up the good work guys. I have used it since 2014.
Looks like a great app to start. The feature that it is missing most is palm rejection. Completely unusable without it. Surely this module could be bought in from someone!!

Perfect for math distance learning. I can emulate my document camera function , record my lesson using Screencastify, and export a PDF of my notes so my students can access them. Perfect for my needs.

The best note taking app I've used so far, over both android and apple! Some features on my wishlist for this app though are for further integration with education apps like google classroom, and of course mass import and export of pdf please!
I'd give it five stars if it had the option of rotating things like text and selected marks. It's a important feature that stops me from loving this app.

As an investigator, this app changes everything! I can take handwritten notes, add a photograph, save it all to a PDF and forward it to my client instantly. Perfect for recording statements, collecting evidence and organising thoughts.
Great for note taking and marking up PDFs. Wish there was more seamless integration with Google Drive and an option to create custom templates.
Great app but it would be easier to use if there was an online manual, taking clips does not seem to work for me so I have to use a snipping tool.

It is useful in creating PDFs and sharing. It is not very efficiant to work with the editing tools, adjusting size or changing pages order. But it still allowes to work on PDFs where some other apps don't.
Easy to use PDF annotations for my work, it's really really helpful and straight forward. I wish it also has a desktop app that works together with the mobile app.
Very good handwriting editing experience on my Galaxy S Tab 3, better than the Samsung Notes app. I would like to be able to search my notes using OCR on the handwriting. Then I would give 5 stars.

If the designers could incorporate more writing implements i.e. calligraphy pens (these are superb in Samsung Notes) then I would give this 5 stars. So it's good, but could be brilliant.
Nice app, looks great, gets the job done. Subscribed to be able to make notes on my pdf files. Wish there were more types of pens and a convert to text option though!
Great interface! It's easy to use and easy to customize to be whatever you're wanting out of a notes app or pdf editor app.

I run multplie D&D games and Squid has helped me manage my notes and use less paper. I was going through pads of post-its and note books like crazy. Now I can still feel like I am writing while saving on paper goods.
Awesome tool to replace paper. I use it as my notebook in college and it works. I just wish it had more options pen options. And also, the writing was more precise.

I use Squid for teaching high school math when I am absent from school. I load up a lesson PDF into Squid, write on my screen with my Note 10+ phone, and record my voice and writing with Screen Recorder Edge. It works very well and is easy to do.
Great tool for taking notes and ability to print. I would like to see an option to buy all premium features for one lifetime price.
My favourite note taking app. Works great with Samsung note stylus. Finger erase is really convenient, as you don't have to switch between pen and eraser. Wish it was available in windows
Love the app. I use it all the time! While one can never get everything we want, I do wish it had the ability to search for text in documents.
Very easy to use and support PDF file

Fantastic. Works great and makes me glad I got the pen. works great for notes and for letting my kids draw.

The other big missing feature is the ability to back up to Google Drive as a cloud option. Great app, but not all the way there yet. Its hands down the best note taking app on Chrome OS thus far, but still pales in comparison to One Note on a Windows device. I love what the developers are doing though. There needs to be a better implementation of typed text to written text though. For all...Full ReviewGreat app, but not all the way there yet. Its hands down the best note taking app on Chrome OS thus far, but still pales in comparison to One Note on a Windows device. I love what the developers are doing though. There needs to be a better implementation of typed text to written text though. For all the bells and whistles One Note has, thats the are where it is far superior to this app. Not having to type something one sentence at a time or convert something to PDF just so I can import it into Squid keeps it second place for now. pen support on the pixelbook is great, writes much more smoothly than in keep. However, many critical features that could make this the perfect note-taking app for chrome os are missing. For instance, you cannot scroll continuously through pages of pdfs, and you can't have more than one note open at...Full Reviewpen support on the pixelbook is great, writes much more smoothly than in keep. However, many critical features that could make this the perfect note-taking app for chrome os are missing. For instance, you cannot scroll continuously through pages of pdfs, and you can't have more than one note open at once (for instance, marking up a pdf textbook and taking notes at the same time). The app also does not have access to local files on the computer, although I have read that this is an issue with android apps in chrome os. Squid does not support syncing to other devices or to Google drive. I have also been experiencing some crashing while working on larger notes. Otherwise, out of all the mediocre/broken ways of taking notes and drawing on chrome os that I have tried so far, this is the least mediocre/broken

This is a really outstanding note taking app for android, if not the best. Taking notes with an active pen is really easy and practical. The interface is really nice and simple. Also a fair price for premium options which really are usefull. The fact that pdfs are exported without being splitted int...Full ReviewThis is a really outstanding note taking app for android, if not the best. Taking notes with an active pen is really easy and practical. The interface is really nice and simple. Also a fair price for premium options which really are usefull. The fact that pdfs are exported without being splitted into a4 format (or any format for that matter) is really nice, something that can't be done in onenote for example. Some functions, however, could be better. It would be nice to import PDF files within a note so that you can annotate the PDF file (instead of importing PDF pages seperately as a new page). Also, it would also be nice to have some more figures that you can draw besides the line, square and circle (for example, 2d or 3d axis, triangle, arrows, dotted line etc.) and the option of filling a figure with a certain color. Another thing that can be better are the sync options, OneDrive or GoogleDrive are currently not supported for example.

I recently switched over to digital note taking for college and this app has allowed me to take even better notes than I could by hand. Should not have half the screen disappear. No, it's not the tablet. I use One Note by Microsoft, and I have none of these issues. Honestly not worth it.   I would recommend One Note, which is free and writes smoothly (plus you have access to all your notes on the web for free), or Xodo, which lets you highlight pdf's (I imported a 2000 page document, no issues scrolling entire document), also can add text, draw, and more. Going back to that, should have never left. Figured a paid app would be better than a free one, I was wrong. Really would like a refund.

Amazing app when compared with all the other apps that I've used for notetaking on my tablets. I use it all the time to take notes during class/ doing assignments/ doodling. Overall, an excellent note-taking app! The ability to use styli and fingers for different actions is very intuitive, and editing works like a charm. The ability to use styli and fingers for different actions is very intuitive, and editing works like a charm. Overall, It's a pretty efficient note taking app. Lots of colors for ink/ highlighting options, import pdfs/export notes as pdfs (very cool), plus uploading to my google drive. In order to make straight lines or perfect shapes, you have to entirely select a different tool, then switch back to the regular pen. I wish this were a) more seamless or atleast b) provided more options (like circles instead of just elliptical objects), or parabolas (or even better graph plotting!), or maybe just stars and stuff. But that's really the only complaint I have with it. Everything else is awesome.

Without it the writing experience is fair but is definitely laggy and no longer stands out. PLS fix this!

But for this review, I'd like to suggest that the devs of Squid try downloading INKredible, the leading competitor for handwritten notes (on Android at least; idk for iOS). There are a lot of similarities and differences, and pros and cons for each, but ultimately I chose to keep Squid. It wasn't an easy choice though, and I hope for Squid to improve to a point where it /would/ be an easy choice. That is, for Squid to implement all the "pros" without adding any of the "cons" of its competitor.

Excellent app for my chromebook. All it need is regular updates and new features time to time. The new features come in very slow. One advice to developer is to keep track of your competitor apps like Notability and work on getting those features to this.

Severly lacking compared to iOS GoodNotes. Came from an iPad Pro and an avid user of GoodNotes and Notable on iOS, this app is OK, but lacking many features and usability of the iOS apps by a long shot. Yes, I'm an android phone fan, was attempting to get away from iOS.

Really enjoy this app for notetaking, but it has a tendency to crash way more than personally acceptable. Still my go-to but really inconvenient when you're in the middle of a university lecture and you have to restart your entire laptop in order to continue taking notes :/

The best app for students! Although it would be good if they added more perfect shapes like you can do in Microsoft Office and better cloud features would be appreciated as well. Still it is a very good one and worth your money.

It's 2018. This app is useless without multidevice sync and options for backing up to OneDrive or at least Google Drive. I hoped upgrading to pro would give me these options, but it was a waste of $10. If you don't mind losing your notes, the handwriting experience is otherwise nice.

I use this app on my phone and tablet for school note taking. It works awesome. I would've given 5 stars but I wish there was way to link account from multiple devices. That way I can see my notes from my tablet on my phone as well.

Great note taking app overall. I'd even give it 5*, however I really miss the automatic shape detection as well as some kind of toolbar where I could choose and save most frequently used pens that I use. Option for cloud storage to Google Drive would be cool to have as well.

The best option to date for android users. Way, way, way better than OneNote. It requires just a few minor improvements, like some way of contrast increasing of highlighted text, and an option for scrolling down from page to page.
Amazing !!! So much better the one note mobile app. Very comfortable, usable, user friendly!!
Great vector image editor with a focus on pen input. Works great with the Galaxy Note series.
Paying just sucks, but it's worth it üíØ

If you wanna try the PDF tool you must buy the subscription, just to discover that it is very bad: not fluent at all and you can only see 1 page. If you have a note 8 or 9 the default "Write on PDF" is a lot better than this app. So don't buy it if you need this feature

This works really well with my Lenovo yoga book, and is great for taking notes by digitally writing directly onto a PDF. The scrolling can be a bit annoying and imprecise, hence the lack star review. Nevertheless, it's a really handy app and my go to for note taking.

good app for hand writing. please consider improving the HIGHLIGHTER. it makes the letters less visible instead of making the word or sentences pop. also it would be nice if there is a handwriting recognition for drawing simple figures like circles and lines.

It just works. I haven't had any issues and the monthly price is minimal for loads of features. I've been using it to sign PDF documents with a handwritten signature on my Note 9. Saves a ton of time and cost on printing contracts.

So much better than OneNote. So much easier converting notes to other formats so others can use them. Now if only it could read the .one file format. The note app that gets that down will be an instant success.

As a teacher, I find this app extraordinarily useful for class. I can have my students send me drafts of things online, edit them, and return them without wasting any physical paper. I can also digitize notes and send them online so they can keep them on their own digital platforms. Highly recommend...Full ReviewAs a teacher, I find this app extraordinarily useful for class. Just a good note taking app with no fluff, recommend getting premium for added pdf and drawing features. Would like to see more paper layouts and designs in the future. Was brilliant until I decided to purchase and saw that there is no one-off price but rather a subscription model. Shame, the best out there. Will uninstall now. I can't afford renewable subscription purchases. I would have paid to fully unlock with one time purchase.

I love this app, but there is one flaw, it doesn't auto sync across devices. There is a way to sync but it is very manual and it is very easy to accidently deleted everything. In the app, it is so amazing, just needs auto syncing.

Love this app so much that bought premium within 10 minutes of downloading the app. I would really love to see some features though,like ability to have multiple pen colours in tool bar like in one note, And Having Calendar pre set with date instead of all blank (something like a diary page) . Great app. Im an structural engineer and I use to make several notes and draws to specify details in construction place. So the best way is to import the pdf drawing CADS and to draw above and mail them. Is the best way to keep them organized, response fast and clear.

Excellent app for managing my notes. Handwriting recognition is top notch, integrates well with s-pen. There is an annoying bug that when you scroll the page the new section doesn't load until you release your finger. Also a useful new feature would be fixed width infinite height pages.

Easy on the device, but jam packed with useful features! Really helps lecture notes. Save to drive is great and works well. Only thing would be the ability to expand pages in a book to infinite size to be able to make notes around it.
Very useful PDF writer and reader on Lenovo yogaBook. Appears bug -free. No surprises. Modest fees.
Would love some more pen options, layers support, sync into 3rd party apps (evernote?). Otherwise a great app, considering buying premium

Acts like notability for android. So helpful for my studies. I especially like how simple yet complex it is. And premium is just a dollar a month which is such a steal for everything that's included. So happy that I found this app!!

It gave all these features in the description prior to install. Beware... Roughly 2 of the 10 I liked were available. Was hit with a subscription fee just to use a highlighter. A highlighter? Really? No thanks.

My favorite app for my Note stylus. Write with your pen and erase with your finger. Lots of backgrounds and can purchase PDF as background so you can use any PDF as a template! Lots of pen type/color options and pressure sensitivity is perfect. Highly recommend.

I have extensively tested several note taking apps. Microsoft OneNote is hands-down the best. It is more versatile, powerful, collaborative, and cross-platform than Squid. Plus, OneNote is totally free of charge for the full version. I recommend Microsoft OneNote instead.

It's great and I use it for school to write on pdfs but there are things lacking. One thing is that when you try inserting text, it just keeps going in a straight line and won't go to the next line when it hits the edge of the document.
Nice app, but way too expensive

good for writing notes in a hurry. my wish list would be to be able to delete blank lines or gaps where I've removed information. also I've accidentally deleted information when I touch the page with my finger and there's no safety net

brilliant app.life revolving around it currently.preparing all my civil services notes upon squid.only suggestions though: 1.could .mp3 or.mp4 files be added to a page.would be cool to have that level of interactiveness in class notes. 2.the 'take picture ' feature could do with a 'magic scanner ' s...Full Reviewbrilliant app.life revolving around it currently.preparing all my civil services notes upon squid.only suggestions though: 1.could .mp3 or.mp4 files be added to a page.would be cool to have that level of interactiveness in class notes. 2.the 'take picture ' feature could do with a 'magic scanner ' sort of brightening option.

there should be an option for auto hide all everything i should only see the paper. the top and bottom windows distracts me. One More suggestion to add an option to remove a blank line from a ruled sheet layout created when using the eraser to rub something.

I love this app and it has been my saving grace for writing on top of pdfs for school. I used to print them all! However, without syncing between devices I can only give this a four star. My rating will definitely change once syncing is added.

Being able to annotate PDF documents and save them to Dropbox is incredibly powerful. I no longer have to print out and waste paper when reviewing documents, proposals, or other materials in PDF format.

I find Squid indespensibe at work to take extensive handwritten notes on my Samsung Chromebook Plus. The app is quite stable and reliable. The premium backgrounds are helpful for specific applications and are worth the money if you need a different type of paper.

This is a spectacular, reliable app for notetaking on the Google Pixelbook. I am dismayed by the lack of updates bringing new features that make the UI more user-friendly on larger devices, but for $1 a month, it is solid and resonable.
Very good experience. Writing is easy and fun to use through the app.
best note tacking app i`ve used.
Excellent app However it may be includ presentation pointer for teaching on virtual board

in general it is a good app. suggestions: * when you import a pdf, sometimes it take some time to update screen when you move around the page. it shoul be more fluid. * please include a way to move across pages by sweping on the screen.

The ability to annotate pdf documents is really useful. I like the large range of note paper and natural feel of the writing action. The experience is as close to a real writing experience as I've ever have with an app.

Yearly fee? Not happy about that but I've been using it for a month now and it really is an incredible app. I'm able to do just about anything, it's easy to access and easy to organize. The pen and paper options are great, paper templates for pretty much any occasion.

App is simple and has just enough features to be useful to the average person. Overall I like it.   My only question is:   Are there plans to add Hyperlink functionality to the software? I would like to be able to include links in the notes that I take. I would be willing to pay for it.

Loving the features, however using this on an Tab S4 the ink comes out wrinkled not smooth. Also the selection of tools is tedious. Imagine doing math on this making tons of mistakes opening closing a drawer isn't efficient. Support for the a pen button would be amazing.

easily the best handwritten note app for my note 8. I hate other apps that force me to type, and the paper sizing here makes it easy to practice zettelkasten. only improvements I'd want would be the ability to tag and wiki link notes, but this does what I need without those.

nice app ,was using it for 2 to 3 years but developers not adding basic features similar to Samsung notes or Notability, GoodNotes4,Noteshelf2 like apps. plz add at least Zoom in window if possible, other feature like handwriting to text conversion, global text search, multiple tabs, etc.,

Amazing application. Great for me as a student. Just a pity that you need the premium to have the option to highlight, etc. Also wish more fonts came with the premium purchase. Overall very happy with the purchase.

I really like all functions how I can manage pdf files in this app. But hope that I could find certain words by searching in the pdf files ( kinda like ctrl+f).ü§îü§îü§î This would help Squid users a lot!!! Other than that, everything is nice.
Nice to use but will be nicer if have more fonts for typing and more pen types for writing. Overall is okayy :)

Using this app on the TabS4 with a stylist and I absoulutly love the hand written note taking capabilities. The app has a great selection of paper back ground to choose from and inserting pages is a snap. Best app on my tablet!

this app has become very important to my work. being able to import pdfs and write on them has been a godsend! thank you so much for making this app! I just wish there was a faster way to switch between documents.

I uninstalled it the very second I saw you had to buy the premium version just to add text. You have to pay money... to write decent text... in a notebook app. Frankly it's insulting when there are dozens of other options. Go elsewhere people.
Was great until it started crashing in the last week when trying to open. Now I can't open it at all. Considered uninstalling and installing again but then I'd lose what I have saved in there.

Did not backup and all my notes are lost. I subscribed $10 a year to have the dropbox backup feature and it failed. Don't make the same mistake I did. Use an actual notebook or notepads. Or google notes - automatically saves notes to cloud for free.
Hi... Please add option to Bold the text... It helps a lot while making notes...

It's a wonderful note-taker, there is no question about that. I gave it 4 stars because it is not inter-device capable, i.e. it doesn't sync (but, admittedly, feel a touch guilty about not giving it 5 stars).

I used this app few days now for taking lecture notes. This are my observations: (1) bad synchronization (2) no full screen m mode, so my wrist sometimes accidentally press back /home buttons. Overall good app still need some polishing though.

Great app for school. You can organize every class in its own folder. My only gripe is that when you add something to a previous note, it changes the date to when you made the change. Otherwise, it's great for class.
I love this app for note-taking with my Pixelbook. Infinite pages are awesome. Marking up a multi-page PDF is also hard to find in a notes app, but Squid makes it super easy, and it works great.

Only thing keeping this rating from a 5 star is often times on my Pixelbook, when I zoom the screen will go black and take a second before coming back up. I have to close the app and reopen when this happens because the pen will then have significant lag

I use this app all the time. I love that I can take notes in my own handwriting electronically and, with the paid version, have them automatically backed up to Dropbox so I can access my notes from any internet-connected device.

Excellent note taking app, delivers the features I'd hoped existed on Android before purchasing a tablet. PDF import works excellently. Captures my hand writing accurately & legibly on my Samsung Tab S3. Button gestures make for a smooth user experience.

Two main issues tht letme down 1) Pop-up window mode is not working properly in NOTE 9.Whatever i write, moves slightly upwards. 2) No widget where i can use a Note directly on home screen for writing. App must be opened, which is not convenient for me.
Looks interesting. Could use a free trial period to test all features. Doesnt work properly on my Lenovo Yoga Book. It can't tell the difference between the pen and my hand, which is kinda annoying.

I use Squid on my Chromebook Plus V2 to teach my math class. Students can follow along with their own notes page that is identical to the PDF I can cast to screen at the front of class. I can keep all of my classes separated by course and unit. It's great!
Its the best note taking app I have found for handwritten notes on a tablet. I use it for everything. The importing PDF feature is especially nice for taking notes in class.

App works very well, except for portability. Positively the app does almost everything I want it to do and works as advertised. Negatively, the integration with google drive is poor which means what I do in Squid stays on one device.
I paid for pdf markup to test it and it isn't very good. I'd request a refund since I couldn't try it first but there is no function for that! One star will have to suffice!

Great app, very intuitive. The one feature I would change apps for is full screen. When using this app on a Note 8 in landscape view the extra screen real estate taken up by the controls is significant.

flexible and easy to use, intiutive menu and features. the capability to import pdf is a big plus. some improvement can be made like predefined pen size, auto switch between write and erase, and the option for text mode input.
Low-latency ink is really nice but often cuts out, so I have to disable it.
Great for working on pdf files and when using the Samsung pen great for taking notes and highlighting sections. Didn't really appreciate how good it is until I started using it regularly.

Works pretty good for note 9, good for sketching and writing your thoughts. I love the Infinite zoom out feature, its like I have one Page with everything I need and it looks like a great overall picture.

[Updated] This is my favorite note taking app. I would give it 5 stars but it doens't have Google Drive Cloud Backup intergration. Only Dropbox and box are available. It also does not sync well between devices.
A very useful app to quickly jot down notes in meetings. I use it on Samsung Galaxy Note 4, and the stylus makes it even more easy keep up with the pace of speaker.
great app. I use it for note taking in school. I ended up purchasing the subscription because it became more convenient to upload pdf's. I would give 5 stars if it were free for all options.

Good general app but one issue. I can understand the some features you have to buy, I baulk at paying a subscription though, but basic functionality that you can get on other note takers basic applications needs to be included.

Requires premium for everything I want to do. I guess you can probably doodle for free, but that's about all. Premium is a subscription, not a purchase. Not worth it based on all I've been able to see...
Good app, could do with arrows in the tool pack and may be a magnified import pictures, and take pictures
THE CHECKERBOARDING. WHYYYYYYYYY

excellent as is, the free version is perfectly acceptable, but also the only note taking app i found thats actually worth paying for. the only subscription i have and absolutely worth 10 bucks a year.
Very happy with it. Wish you could buy the templates you wanted, not have to subscribe. Won't be subscribing, likely would have bought a few. Works great!
Got this app for work. It does everything I need it to except for one thing: I'd love it if I could insert multiple PDF files to a "note" at one time. Make things faster...

Love this app but after the last update it deleted all of my files for school! Hundreds of hours of note taking down the drain:( Update!:Looking at, I believe it was the fault of a new chromeos update, the update changed the location of my squid files!
there is a few glitches here and there but for the mkst part it works well; I would like to see this app being updated more often sk the latency lag is less likely to happen.
Excellent app. Would like to see a more robust tool menu to make transition between erase, select and write quicker. Would also like to be able to scroll with 1 finger instead of erasing.
works really well, love the option to import pdf's. Wish you Could nest folders.
Very nice app, definitely worth it's subscription fee. I'd really love to be able to cut from pdfs though - that's a very important feature simply missing in this app.

There are a lot of times I feel like the app is not fluid ot what I need it for such as easy jpeg or pdf writing. It's possible that the premium features have this unlocked but so possibly a trial version maybe? Great App though!
This is an incredibly useful app for my Chromebook. Handwriting my notes has never been so satisfying--and, I can still doodle on my pages (this app is a very good double for a drawing one as well!)

Great app so far. Been using it alot to take notes and not need to take a notebook anywhere I go now. using it on a Samsung tab A. Would be nice to have a feature where we can permanently rotate a PDF...

Fantastic for notetaking, general writing. I use it extensively on my galaxy tab for character sheets. Being able to manipulate and interact with what you've written in previous sessions is invaluable.
Very easy to use and adapt to. However capabilities could be more, for example a zoom out box to inrease noting space for small parts of a text would give much more possibility for note taking.

No way to organize notes - this feature was requested six years ago in their website. That's right - six years ago. The app layout is not optimized for Chrome OS yet (see Evernote). Until then, I'm keeping this 1 star rating.
I'm not crazy about subscriptions, but this app is the only one with the features I need. Great for designing furniture and cabinets on graph paper.

waste app.. all the cool and important features are paid.. without the premium package you can only write,erase and select..moreover there is only one type of brush available where you can adjust the pressure and size... Didn't find it much helpful...

Great app for taking notes, however the Gdrive autosync/restore that isn't available is a deal breaker
Awesome. I tried almost all of the similar apps and this is by far the best in terms of ease of use and functionality. It's extremely responsive with no lag between pen and render.
The interface and everything is great but the writings are not smooth when you zoom in on them. They look like made out of straight lines rather than smooth curves.
Useful app, but it has issues backing up notes and I lost months of notes. Active stylus works better than other apps like Google Keep. It's nice to annotate PDFs but tedious to read them! :-/

Love this app so far! I use this to store all of my music for the many choruses I'm in. I have them all in separate folders, and I can mark my music as well. (I have the paid version of the app)
Good app. I like that it allows me to sign things and send without needing to print. Still think it could be quicker with downloading and saving things.
Super useful for saving money on textbooks for classes. I still get to highlight and take notes to my heart's content, but I avoid the costs of traditional college textbooks. Win-win.

Does as advertised. Works well and the ability to insert pdf into the notes is a thumbs up for me. However, I wish they could have added backup to Google Drives.
It is really helpful for annotating PDFs and is a good note taking app. I think it is definitely worth a dollar a month for the expanded features.
to access eraser tool is not smart. we should switch many times between eraser and pen. the best way, both should be separated with one click access. now i am looking for another one in playstore.

This was amazing. I turned my instructor's PowerPoints into PDFs and then took class notes right on the slides with my tablet. Absolutely the best for relating my notes to the relevant class material. No, more paper notebooks for me.
This app is fantastic, but it doesn't support backup to Google Drive which I think is a MAJOR downfall. Otherwise it would be a 5 star app. *Sidenote* S-Pen support is fantastic

makes my work and home projects so much easier. take a pic of a wall, write dimensions on it, add next wall next to it. unlimited sheet size is brilliant and the export to pdf is amazing. fantastic app!
Great app. One of the most useful app for taking notes. Just one fault: it doesn't have multi-devices sync, not even with the Premium pack

Have had this for years but bought a S3 with the S Pen and takes it to a whole new level. It is like having a huge piece of paper with a lot of colored pens to take notes. Outstanding

This is what i am looking for! Only 2 things i needed for this app: 1. Sync from my android device to my windows laptop. 2. Set transparency of paper so i can trace my drawing on top of it on the next page.
Great writing app. Very easy to take notes. I use an S-pen when I use this app and it's fantastic. This app has changed the way I do homework and taking notes.

Worked when I first installed it but hasn't been opening images for annotation for several months now. A bit disappointed. It has potential if it worked as it did when I first installed it.

Using squid with my samsung chrome book pro has been truly a pleasure to work with. I am able to open PDF's, sign documents and take notes all in one app. I would recommend its best use is with a stylus.
The writing experience is amazing, but the inability to have subfolders is a big drawback. I like how lecturenotes allows you to have subfolders and organize notes better.
Great for working with PDFed books. Love it for jotting my notes, adding photos, scribbling and drawing. I wish there was a choice of pens, pencils amd brushes.
Love using it with my Huawei Mate 20 X and M Pen. The only additional feature I'd like to see is a fullscreen mode that hides the menu bars (and ideally the android notification bar as well).
Best notes on Chromebook! I use it with split screen to take notes on Khan Academy. The add-ons are kind of expensive, but over all it's a good app.

Favorite handwritten note app by a million miles. Not without some fine tuning or wanted features, but I stopped trying out other apps after I tried this. (gimme color backgrounds in all page formats T.T )
Super awesome note taking app. It captures your handwriting so effortlessly and accurately. 100% as though as you are writing on the paper. If only it is available on windows 10 too!

Great app for university note-taking on powerpoints! Would give a 5 star review if you could type next to pdf as well as write on them. My only complaint. But few other pdf note-taking apps for chromebook, so I'll take it!
I use Squid everyday and love it! For lists and schedules it's the best. No problems, just a smooth working app that does what it's supposed to do.
All nice thing are on premium üò≠
Excellent app for studying. I was struggling with reading my books but now i can just download them into squid and read them. It also allows you to mark, highlight and mark on the key points. Thnx
Amazingly convenient to sync with Dropbox and export pdfs there. Really responsive to strokes. Minimalistic but offer everything you need if you intend to replace your notebook with your tablet-pen.
This is the best sketching and note taking app I've found. Perhaps some extra pen styles would be good for sketching diagrams, but I also get the minimalist focus on simple, effective note taking.

Completely unable to subscribe to the premium features of this app. Tried several payment methods but none of them worked. Looks like a good app, but too bad i'm not able to use the features I need because of the app not allowing me to pay!
This is a good useful app, well done! But why would I pay when one note is free?
It's a great app I always use it to take notes I just wish they'd add more features to it like a recorder and also add more varieties to the type of files that I can upload
I love the lined paper design. This is the most satisfactory note app I've tried in regards to the feel. I hope to see more widget options in the future
LOVE IT for taking notes on blank documents and PDF's! Easy to use for editing, and organizing files. Everything I need.
Works Great! As an adjuster this app has allowed me to go paperless. No more printing out estimates. I just download PDF's, mark up as needed and save. Love it!
Probably the best hand writing app for notes on Android. Wish it had better support for typing so I didnt have to use two apps though. Also having a subcategory to the notebooks would be lovely.
Very solid note taking app, love the different kinds of paper. Wishing there were some shapes that we're free to use (boxes, lines/arrows, circle)

Absolutely fantastic on my Pixelbook (+Pen)! My go to note taking and journal writing and an essential tool for my academic studies! The ability to upload PDFs and then to make notes on the pen is amazing!
Its a very nice app, really help me with every kind of anotation. I would like to see a directory sistem. Instead of see my documents i could see the directories, something like that.
I love this app, I use it on my pixelbook and my phone to take class notes and highlight our pdf readings for classes. it's just what I was looking for!

Since getting my note I have been looking for the best writing app for notes and doing homework. This is awesome with the paid feature of .pdf import. I have tried about a dozen apps and prefer Squid.
I love this app, is very useful. My only complaint would be the text box, it would be better to add text directly to the page and not through a text box.
Squid is super useful for editing PDFs. You can mock them up in various colors, various pen widths, etc. There is no pen lag--couldn't be happier :)
Love it. i almost never use paper now. Can you make it so we can permanently buy a background? instead of subscribing to premium just to get one background.
Unreliable now a few times -- files fail to save to pdfs, which makes the utility essentially useless for me. If this happens again I will have to find another application to use.
One of the best note taking apps. Definitely 5 stars if they add Google Drive as a cloud storage option and the ability to hide the dock on a Chromebook when taking a note.
I've tried several handwritten notes app. Squid gives me more flexibility and ease of use. I just hope there will be more templates available in the future,.
This is a beautiful app that allows me to take all of my notes and do my assignments in one place. Subscription is super cheap too and is easily worth the investment.
Useful app, integrates well with stylus usage. Cloud storage, gesture navigation and the ability to change the colour of your paper would make it better!
A fine app except for one thing: I'm not interested in subscribing for functionality that should be included in a basic application. A one time reasonable purchase, sure.
The app is great. The only major flaw is lack of ability to view the notes on my dekstop. I have to export and send to my desktop if I need a note.
awesome note taking app, just wish I was also able to upload as a word doc and PowerPoint. I have to keep converting the format. Otherwise, nice app.

Excellent app for capturing my handwriting! I use it on a Chromebook Pro, and it's even smoother than writing on paper. I'm able to easily organize my notes into notebooks, add pages to my notes, and even change whether I'm writing with notebook paper lines, graph paper, or plane white. And did I me...Full ReviewExcellent app for capturing my handwriting! I use it on a Chromebook Pro, and it's even smoother than writing on paper. I'm able to easily organize my notes into notebooks, add pages to my notes, and even change whether I'm writing with notebook paper lines, graph paper, or plane white. And did I mention you can change the colors and thickness of the ink? Now, I'm not a fan of subscribing to things - the freemium version of Squid will do almost everything you need for notetaking, and I'm very happy with it. I did some in-app purchases for typing on the screen and adding shapes, and those have been worthwhile and affordable. --- Update: I now also have the app on my phone, and alas there is no way to sync the notes from my phone and my Chromebook. However, both my phone and Chromebook automatically backup my notes to Dropbox every day as PDF's, and it's easy to export the really important notes to specific folders in my Google Drive (and other online platforms) as needed. Plus you can't beat the control for line thickness, color, and page background. Granted, you get even better backgrounds (including daily planner) if you sign up for premium, and I can't afford that. But with a few in-app purchases you can get PDF and JPG import, which will them provide any background you could possibly want. I actually use the app to take photos and then draw sketches over the photos. Once the sketch is done, I copy the lines over to a plain white background, and voila - a nice cartoon image. Do if you're looking for a versatile and dependable notes app with automatic backup, I think this may be your best bet.

The best writing app among samsung notes, one note (free android version) simply because I can set page size and organize my notes well.   UPDATE: After using this app for almost 2 years now, I must say that this is still my app of choice for taking notes in school. Nice colors, for smooth writing a...Full ReviewThe best writing app among samsung notes, one note (free android version) simply because I can set page size and organize my notes well.   UPDATE: After using this app for almost 2 years now, I must say that this is still my app of choice for taking notes in school. Nice colors, for smooth writing and prints fantastically. The biggest problem with other apps is their inability to provide a straightforward way to get notes into PDF properly for printing purposes. Squid is the way to go for taking notes in school, writing assignments and printing.  Only thing I would change in this app is a way to save my notes to the SD card. After almost 2 years, I am running out of space on the pre-installed storage. Also, the lack of a way to export an entire notebook means that I have to manually export each note as PDF to copy that notebook to my long-term storage. That is very tedious but looks like I have no other way to save my notes and free-up space.  My advice for newbies is to export your notes daily or weekly and at the end of a semester delete the notebook to save space. You will thank me later.  Thank the developers for a very useful note-taking app.

Edit: Developers have sat on the app without providing new features. Subscriptions are a two way street, users pay developers a reoccuring fee in return for ...Full ReviewEdit 2: Nice non-apology. You guys can keep your monopoly on handwriten note apps on Chromebook, I'm switching back to Windows with OneNote.   Edit: Developers have sat on the app without providing new features. Subscriptions are a two way street, users pay developers a reoccuring fee in return for improvements. Sure there is the occasional "bug fix and optimization" update, but where is the Google Drive sync? Where is the handwriting search? Compared to other apps like LectureNotes and OneNote, Squid is very minimal and honestly it just doesn't compare.   Compared to LectureNotes, the pricing for tools is a somewhat big investment. LectureNotes lets you get all the features with just 1 payment while this makes you pay separately for tools, pdf import, cloud, etc.

I gave it an honest shot. While it is a beautiful app, it lacks the basic staples needed for success. No collaboration, no ability to rearrange notes within a notebook, and most importantly, NO SYNC. This is almost laughable! What powerful note taking app doesn't sync? Doing manual backups and resto...Full ReviewI gave it an honest shot. While it is a beautiful app, it lacks the basic staples needed for success. No collaboration, no ability to rearrange notes within a notebook, and most importantly, NO SYNC. This is almost laughable! What powerful note taking app doesn't sync? Doing manual backups and restorations is not only archaic, it is a major liability. How easy is it to lose an entire year of work by accidentally resorting an incorrect backup? Come on guys, this is a no brainer. UPDATE: I dropped from three stars to two stars. I have lost numerous documents because of the lack of syncing options. Also, there has been more than enough time for Squid to update their app to allow automatic syncing. While I understand you can set an automatic cloud update, this is still not helpful because you have to manually restore a backup EVERY SINGLE TIME you use a different device. It is ridiculous.

It's a little less functional than I'd like it to be, but for free it comes with enough to draw in different colors and thicknesses and embed images. The strokes with the Pixel Pen are pressure sensitive to increase and decrease the thickness too. You have to pay a couple bucks for the rest of the t...Full ReviewIt's a little less functional than I'd like it to be, but for free it comes with enough to draw in different colors and thicknesses and embed images. The strokes with the Pixel Pen are pressure sensitive to increase and decrease the thickness too. You have to pay a couple bucks for the rest of the templates, but it's not a bad price for an app. You can increase page size and change the dimensions to that of different paper standards, add lines or grids, and export to pdf, jpeg, or png. You can also add multiple pages to a single note and organize notes into different notebooks. Works with just a finger too! Lastly, (and I like this feature a lot), you can import pdfs. Great for doing homework right on the assignment. Feature request: add layers for additional drawing tools. I use this app mostly for dungeons and dragons mapping (mirrorring screen with a Chromecast), and having layers would make it infinitely easier to handle fogs of war and the like.

Good app, handles the basics nicely. I'm definitely able to use this to get work done and for the most part it stays out of my way. I will mention, since sometimes the devs read these, that I find the UI to be a bit clunky at times. For instance, I am often transfering between different modes (penci...Full ReviewGood app, handles the basics nicely. I'm definitely able to use this to get work done and for the most part it stays out of my way. I will mention, since sometimes the devs read these, that I find the UI to be a bit clunky at times. For instance, I am often transfering between different modes (pencil, highlight, etc) and each transfer takes two button presses followed by a menu-clearing action. I really feel like this should be doable in a single action. Additionally, I am often times switching between different colors/thicknesses or have things that I am copying and pasting regularly. Two very useful features would be (a) color/line-thickness presets for both shapes and writing, and (b) a 'palette' where figures I have drawn can be saved for later use. A walk through of (b) would be: i. I draw a figure and decide to save it for later ii. I highlight the figure and touch button 'add-to-palette', adding the highlighted figure. iii. Later, I want to reuse my figure. I select the palette icon which presents a dropdown of thumbnail icons of each figure. iv. I select one figure and it pastes to the screen

I really love this app, it is so helpful for taking notes in my college courses. There are, however, a few features that I wish could be added/modified. It would be nice if you could erase specific areas of something you've written or drawn, instead of erasing everything that I wrote/drew prior to l...Full ReviewI really love this app, it is so helpful for taking notes in my college courses. There are, however, a few features that I wish could be added/modified. It would be nice if you could erase specific areas of something you've written or drawn, instead of erasing everything that I wrote/drew prior to lifting my pen (ex: cursive). I also wish that it were an option to turn handwriting into text and be able to convert it into a Google Doc for easier edits later on. I love handwriting notes because I feel like I can retain the information better, but sometimes, I like the look of typed notes better and I don't always have time to type my notse after writing them. Lastly, it would be really nice to be able to multitask while using the app. I often watch lecture videos and read my electronic textbooks on my Google Pixelbook while taking notes on the screen, and only being able to do one or the other in tablet mode is not very efficient. I would really appreciate it if some of these concerns could be addressed. I think a few adjustments would make this app even more awesome!

for better funcionality 1. ability to rotate pages in PDFs. Often times I 
get PDFs where the pages are rotated every which way. 2. Ability to resize 
and edit text boxes and the ability to move them after they are placed. 
Once they are placed they can't be editied. 3. Ability to copy markups and

often have comments that are for myself and comments for the intended 
recipient. It would be great if there was a layer I could turn off / turn 
on for comments to myself.

notes. One feature I love, is that you can use a single finger to pan while

and phone. Cons:Shape support is limited to circle/oval, rectangle, and

rotating selected objects.

my purse and use your app. Unfortunately, that idea has worn away with the 
monthly fee to use the app. If you offered your app for $10 straight, I 
would buy it. But $10 - $12 per year? No. Other than that, this app really

continue to work with Xodo.

ca...Full ReviewSquid is the only non Google app that seems to be optimised for the stylus 
on the Google Pixelbook. It is very smooth and a great experience to 
write/sketch/diagram with. The negatives for me are that you get a limited 
set of backgrounds to use. If you want to use more or import your own, you 
can't just upgrade to a one off premium version. You have to purchase a 
monthly subscription which is just not worth it. This one money making 
measure for me limits the usefulness of this app. I have purchased the 
tools upgrade for ¬£2.89. This lets me use all the tools (highlighter, etc.) 
I would have like a similar upgrade option for the backgrounds too but 
sadly not the case. I am still therefore on the lookout for an alternative 
that offers more freedom for a one off upgrade cost.

It would be much more useful with two-page view or a scroll mode that allows swiping/clicking to scroll a whole page at a time. Right now, trying to read using Squid requires careful scrolling to advance to the next page, or constantly pulling down the toolbar to get the arrow buttons.

univers...Full ReviewI use this app for taking notes on my lecture slides. The problem that I 
keep having is with slides that have a lot of pictures on them. I end up 
having to wait a long time for those pages to lead, which makes me miss 
some of the notes I want to take down. This is very important to me as 
university classes are very fast paced and profs don't wait for anyone. One 
suggestion would be to have the option to flatten the document as you 
import it onto the app. I personally don't care to have my pages be 
flattened, as I won't be needing to export text or images from my pdfs. I 
understand that some people might still need their content to be separable, 
so I think adding the option to flatten your pdf is better than making it 
the default. Please address this issue this app is extremely helpful 
otherwise.

I tried lots of different Handwriting programs. Squid was not my first 
choice, but it did a few things better than all the others. The main thing 
was that it worked tolerably at a high resolution on my tablet. Others were 
far too slow to work at my top resolution. The second thing that it did was...Full ReviewI tried lots of different Handwriting programs. Squid was not my first 
choice, but it did a few things better than all the others. The main thing 
was that it worked tolerably at a high resolution on my tablet. Others were 
far too slow to work at my top resolution. The second thing that it did was 
that I could import and export PDF's. Other programs had other features 
that I wanted, but did not need. For example, Squid did not zoom, but that 
really did not matter because I did not need it. Still others handled 
drawings better or had more robust file management, but these were usually 
coupled with intolerably slow Handwriting rendering. Squid had the features 
that I needed and worked fine at high resolution. I have used Squid as my 
Handwriting program for several months and I have grown to like it quite a 
bit over time. There are many improvements I could suggest, but nothing I 
suggest would matter over what it already does and does well.

end ...Full ReviewThe app is overall great. You can import pdf files and markup if you get 
the premium, which is worth it if you are reading a lot of pdfs. My only 
complaint is that the pressure sensitive pen option is not as good as it 
can be. The useful pressure range remains small and most of the time you 
end up writing either very thin or very thick. It would be great if they 
could more options to the pressure setting.

Its...Full ReviewSupports amazing features such as using only the stylus for input combined with using your finger as an eraser. The lasso tool is a winner, better than OneNote's, with it you can change the color and the width of previously made pencil marks. It has a wide array of paper templates, color picker. Its fantastic. Also, you can change the size of the paper, facilitating export/printing, something in which OneNote has greatly failed me before. There is PDF import/export, and editing. 4*only because the writing is pretty clunky, needs smoothing, and there is only one kind of pen. Also, I would like to see notebook subdivisions! Premium subscription is totally worth (10/yr approx 0.83¬¢/month, Bargain!)

Fantastic for what it aims to do, which is being a handwriting app. The

Great app, I use this on a Samsung Galaxy tablet with an s-pen. It's my go 
to app for note taking. The infinite page option is great for diagram 
sketching and then pen sensitivity and tracking accuracy beats the built in 
S Note app for my purposes. Being able to zoom in and annotate in fine 
deta...Full ReviewGreat app, I use this on a Samsung Galaxy tablet with an s-pen. It's my go 
to app for note taking. The infinite page option is great for diagram 
sketching and then pen sensitivity and tracking accuracy beats the built in 
S Note app for my purposes. Being able to zoom in and annotate in fine 
detail is a great feature, as is the high quality export. The only areas 
where the Samsung app wins out are in more advanced page indexing 
facilities, and built in sound recording. Plenty of app store options for 
audio recording though. Highly recommend if you use your phone or tablet as 
a productivity tool.

I love this app, I use it for all my highschool notes. It is by far the 
best writing experience on an android tablet that I have seen. But there 
are two things I would love to see done better. First I would love it to 
have more options with notebooks, maybe having the option to create 
multiple n...Full ReviewI love this app, I use it for all my highschool notes. It is by far the 
best writing experience on an android tablet that I have seen. But there 
are two things I would love to see done better. First I would love it to 
have more options with notebooks, maybe having the option to create 
multiple notebooks within notebook. I also feel the tools could have more 
customization, for instance, what if I want the square template but also 
want the pen opacity to be down? It would also be nice to store different 
pens that I use, I like taking my main notes in black and then adding Sub 
notes in pink but also with a smaller pen width, I don't want to have to 
toggle both of those when trying to change pens, especially during class.it 
would be nice to all my favourite pen set ups just a click away.

I think this app is awesome! I love that it has (1) the option to buy 
outright only the upgrade options you require, (2) the ability to create 
folders for notes (3) the import pdf option (I used that straight away!) 
(4) Saving & exporting WITHOUT re cloud - essential for those of us with 
confide...Full ReviewI think this app is awesome! I love that it has (1) the option to buy 
outright only the upgrade options you require, (2) the ability to create 
folders for notes (3) the import pdf option (I used that straight away!) 
(4) Saving & exporting WITHOUT re cloud - essential for those of us with 
confidential info, (5) great export options, (7) page sizes that expand in 
any direction you want(7) easy change in colours (8) lots of options to set 
how use gestures & stylus, & (9) fantastically small export file sizes. I 
would have given a 5 star rating if you could (1) choose the default folder 
you could have it open in, (2) have subfolders (3) be able to see the full 
name of a note when in a folder (4) choose to see the notes as a list 
rather than a thumbnail & MOST OF ALL, (5) a textbox where can wrap text & 
adjust the size & shape of the entry. This problem with the textbox going 
off in one line ad infinitum is a fault at needs to be corrected. 
Otherwise, my team have all chosen Squid as their default work tool to take 
clinical notes with clients in the field using their Samsung Note8 phones. 
If the textbox issue was fixed, the app would be perfect for our needs! 
Thanks for having the best option available.

ov...Full ReviewAs a math professor, I downloaded this app as a way to workout homeork 
problems for my students, and to take notes during meetings. This was an 
okay app until I upgraded to premium. It now allows me to take my quizzes, 
tests, class notes, power points, pdf, etc, open them in squid, then write 
over them. Couple this with a screen recording app, and I hope to greatly 
expand my reach as an educator (woe be unto my students). Also, couple this 
with a document scaning app, and now you can scan/import meeting handouts, 
add notes/write over them, and squid will save it as 1 file. It is a great 
way to actually digitize meeting notes and keep your office from getting 
over cluttered with handouts. As a note taking app, the writing reconition 
is very good (just set your s pen button to the eraser); however, I have 
not tried out using pressure sensitivity to adjust writing thickness.

PDF functionality does need a bit of refinement:  1) It would be nic...Full ReviewWorks very well on Samsung Chromebook Pro; premium features are generally well crafted and thoughtful. Stylus works extremely well (though performance sometimes dips when CPU is throttled due to heat, e.g. during some charging).    PDF functionality does need a bit of refinement:  1) It would be nice to have ways to scroll between pages without pressing the (rather small) arrow buttons in the UI.        2) Import/export functionality currently flattens annotations and destroys ToC/bookmark functionality. I'd *really* like to be able to move between the Squid app and my desktop PDF app without losing the ability to navigate between chapters/bookmarks, and it would be nice too to be able to manipulate the markup I generate in Squid on the desktop (and to preserve annotations made on the desktop such as post-it style comments)         3) The automatic PDF cloud export is better in theory than practice -- if you change a Squid note's name, you'll have to manually go in and delete the old PDF, and export attempts fail far too often (ditto database backups).

HOWEVER, developers, it's been a very long time already since u first came out, it's time u add these feature already: Please, augment the pen selection - now there is only 1 pen style. Also, subfolder/directory ability, to be able to organize better.   02/14/18  Update I think it's time you integrate these critical things I've asked for for months. On my Samsung Galaxy Note 4, which has a resolution of 2560x1440 and a Super AMOLED display, I use the "Squid - Take Notes & Markup PDFs" writing app from the Google play store. And I must say, the writing experience is the closest thing to actually using pencil/pen on paper of a number of popular a...Full ReviewOn my Samsung Galaxy Note 4, which has a resolution of 2560x1440 and a Super AMOLED display, I use the "Squid - Take Notes & Markup PDFs" writing app from the Google play store. And I must say, the writing experience is the closest thing to actually using pencil/pen on paper of a number of popular apps I tested; even better then Samsung's own S Note. The Squid app, which used to be called Papyrus, has near zero latency when writing or drawing. And when comparing Squid to other apps such as Autodesk SketchBook and Wacom's Bamboo Paper on my Note 4, Squid wins hands down. The latency in the other apps is very noticeable, when coming from a Squid writing/drawing session. I use a Staedtler Noris Digital Samsung Pencil, which is sold on Amazon for $19.99.
