Re-started the app, used different export options, and yet no export with both the original document and my signature.  The only reason I even give a second star is because (1) the note-taking is pretty good and (2) the Active Pen on Pixelbook worked well on Squid.  Don't bother with the paid version.

Most responsive note taking app ever. Using an spen, it has almost no lag, which feels amazing and is very important for fluid hand writing, sure the lines are sligtly jagged, and less processed compared to one note or something but its much faster and feels way better - I can actually use my spen o...Full ReviewMost responsive note taking app ever. Using an spen, it has almost no lag, which feels amazing and is very important for fluid hand writing, sure the lines are sligtly jagged, and less processed compared to one note or something but its much faster and feels way better - I can actually use my spen on my device now!!

I recently got a Samsung Chromebook Pro for school, and I absolutely LOVE taking notes with this app.  I can have separate notebooks for all my different classes, I can use their infinite pages to fit an entire lecture's notes on a single page, making it really easy to find the notes from a specific...Full ReviewI recently got a Samsung Chromebook Pro for school, and I absolutely LOVE taking notes with this app.  I can have separate notebooks for all my different classes, I can use their infinite pages to fit an entire lecture's notes on a single page, making it really easy to find the notes from a specific day.  I'm pretty sure my classmates are all really grateful that I can easily turn my notes into a pdf that I can email to them too.  Lots of customization in how the pen works (I've found that 0.3 without pressure sensitivity works best for me).  I love the zoom feature.  It's really nice when you want to write small notes about something but you don't want to take up a whole line. I paid the few extra bucks for the "premium" upgrade, which if I remember correctly included the highlighter option, which is quite nice as well.  The premium package also has a bunch of other page templates like graph paper and stuff which I'll probably never use, but I'm sure would be super handy for someone else.  Honestly, I think my only complaints is that the highlighter doesn't look right... but that could just be that I haven't played around with the settings enough.  I've also had a couple crashes, but I've never lost anything and it's pretty rare and doesn't even take long to restart the app. I definitely recommend this app if you have a tablet with a stylus.  EDIT:  I can't believe I forgot to mention my absolute favorite feature!  THE UNDO BUTTON! I use it so often that I've actually found myself reaching for it when I make a mistake on actual paper!  The eraser is really nice too because it can get rid of an entire penstroke at once (though you can swap so that it only erases what you want too).  And I use the lasso tool a ton when I want to move things around, or copy and paste diagrams and stuff.  Honestly, I love how clean I can make my notes with this app (and how easy it is to do so)!

This is almost a great app with a few frustrating flaws. First, its really great to have an app that allows you to draw and "paint" right over PDF's. I use this for marking up landscape drawings with edits for the drafting team. I also use it for responding to questions from contractors. In this, it...Full ReviewThis is almost a great app with a few frustrating flaws. First, its really great to have an app that allows you to draw and "paint" right over PDF's. I use this for marking up landscape drawings with edits for the drafting team. I also use it for responding to questions from contractors. In this, it works well - it's very well synced with dropbox, Google Drive, and any other way you like to share. A few simple problems, however, are VERY frustrating. 1. From my experience and research, you cannot erase part of highlighted areas (which I used frequently). It is an all or nothing delete. 2.  With no confirmation for closing a file, I sometimes bump the back button and the file closes. Auto saving keeps me from losing the file, but I also lose the option for undoing. Not huge, but definitely frustrating. Add a confirmation screen for exiting and the problem is gone. More to come...

The first feature would be to have folders within the note books. For example have a circuits note book and some folders in there, one for clas...Full ReviewI love this app because I'm always taking notes during class or doing homework, and It works great with the s pen. However I would like some features added. The first feature would be to have folders within the note books. For example have a circuits note book and some folders in there, one for class notes, one for homework, and one for practice. This would greatly enhance the app and would definitely make it 5/5.  Another feature that I would love to see is to have a "night mode" where the background is black and the lines in the paper white so it's easier to write and not shed too much light in the room if it's during a presentation with the lights turned off.  Another feature I would love to see would be top add different backgrounds. Finally I would love to have the option to add pages in a pdf, not just at the end but between pages so I can take more explicit notes.  All this features would make this app be on top for a long time.  However, even without them this app is amazing.

This is quite possibly the best "note-taking" app I've ever used.. but it's so much more than that.   It's a very powerful vector drawing tool, with an extremely simple but powerful interface. If you have some text you've hand-written, you can then go and select parts of it, then change the size, or...Full ReviewThis is quite possibly the best "note-taking" app I've ever used.. but it's so much more than that.   It's a very powerful vector drawing tool, with an extremely simple but powerful interface. If you have some text you've hand-written, you can then go and select parts of it, then change the size, or the color, or the brush stroke thickness, or even duplicate it several times then slightly modify each one, rather than having to write something from scratch several times.   And since it's vector-based rather than rasterised, there's no quality loss to writing/drawing something at one size, and then later resizing it, or dragging it around the place, etc. <3  Basically, it's a really fantastic app. I'm very happy that I stumbled upon it however many years ago when I first got a tablet with a built-in stylus, and it has served me well ever since.    Probably the one feature that it's """missing""" (and I say that in the sense that I have absolutely no expectation of it being a feature) would be being able to choose custom typefaces / write with a monospaced font (and beyond that, being able to write syntax-highlighted code....) -- it's a very specific use-case :)

However this app could use some minor tweeks to make it comparable to platforms like evernote.  If the creators of squid do not intend to make this app to wholesome, by updating the...Full ReviewI would give squid 5 stars because it  does serve as an incredible platform to use handwriting on touchscreen devices. However this app could use some minor tweeks to make it comparable to platforms like evernote.  If the creators of squid do not intend to make this app to wholesome, by updating the app to add features such as typing word documents and organizational tools like sub-folders. Squid should expect that users will want to  combine their notes with the other material on a platform that provides these details. The app does allow for exporting or backing up documents using drop-box or box, but there is no easy way to quickly upload to other platforms like onedrive or the google cloud.   This app is great if you're just trying to jot down some stuff on a touchscreen device. However if you intend to use it as your primary tool for school or work, the app needs some help before it can provide as a good platform for all of your work.

Squid, an Android app running under Chrome OS, is marvelous and adapts to the large screen like a native app. I recommend!!

Best note taking app that supports the active pen. Premium purchases are worth it. Much easier to use then LectureNotes, but not as customizable. There is no latency in regards to pen input. The pen chooser is quick and intuitive, but there is room for improvement. I purchased all the premium featur...Full ReviewBest note taking app that supports the active pen. Premium purchases are worth it. Much easier to use then LectureNotes, but not as customizable. There is no latency in regards to pen input. The pen chooser is quick and intuitive, but there is room for improvement. I purchased all the premium features and among them my favorites are the highlighter and PDF import. Premium paper patterns are only available as a subscription service. The cloud backup (also premium) implements Dropbox or Box as the backup service, which works fairly well as a backup tool. However, I would like a cloud sync feature (like Dropbox on the PC or like Google Drive) so that my notes automatically sync across devices. Right now, it works more like a backup service then a sync service even though it uses Dropbox. Your changes on one device will not sync to the other device, you have to do this manually by restoring from a backup and saving a backup.

Paid user here. This app has so much potential and is so useful, but it is hurt by a few key problems. If the following could be fixed, it would be one of the best apps on the Play Store:  1 - Please add continuous scroll for PDFs, like in Adobe Reader / Foxit.  2 - If you add continuous scroll, ple...Full ReviewPaid user here. This app has so much potential and is so useful, but it is hurt by a few key problems. If the following could be fixed, it would be one of the best apps on the Play Store:  1 - Please add continuous scroll for PDFs, like in Adobe Reader / Foxit.  2 - If you add continuous scroll, please allow PDFs to still be editable in continuous scroll! 3 - Please allow default widths to be applicable to imported pdfs, whether in portrait or landscape; it's a huge pain to have to continuously zoom in or out for every page of a document I'm reading / scrolling through.  4 - Please enable full screen with no toolbar up top; maybe a single finger tap could call up or hide the toolbar, like in many other apps? 5 - please enable inverted dark theme for text / white background! For example, if I'm reading and annotating a screenplay, especially at night or on an AMOLED display, it would be great to be able to make the white PDF background black.   I've been hopping between Squid and Adobe Reader on my tablet because both apps do half of what I need. If squid could add the above, it would be great and I would keep paying for it.

I recently switched to squid for my work notes, because of its ability to work offline, edit pdfs, save directly to my phone (note 4), work with my stylus, and locally backup notes.  I've used a number of the more popular notetaking apps for work or personal notes, and so far am pleased with squid's...Full ReviewI recently switched to squid for my work notes, because of its ability to work offline, edit pdfs, save directly to my phone (note 4), work with my stylus, and locally backup notes.  I've used a number of the more popular notetaking apps for work or personal notes, and so far am pleased with squid's capabilities.  I think it is definitely a developing app, with a lot of room for improvement, but most people would find it useful and user friendly.  A couple freatures I would like to see is the ability to have notebooks within notebooks (for better note storage) and a close-up mode similar to snote or inkredible (I like taking notes on letter sized paper, which is a little frustrating with this app.  The infinite page works well though).  Would definitely recommend giving it a try!

I use my tablet for note taking for university and used it during a levels. In the past I gave this app a 5 star review saying all it needed was a writing input zone (something I know many many other users would agree with). I am extremely disappointed to see it still hasn't been added as a feature,...Full ReviewI use my tablet for note taking for university and used it during a levels. In the past I gave this app a 5 star review saying all it needed was a writing input zone (something I know many many other users would agree with). I am extremely disappointed to see it still hasn't been added as a feature, especially as users have been requesting it for such a long time. It would make writing in this app much much much easier. Something like what lecture notes and notability have in this regards would go a long way. Also having endless scrolling for your pages (again like lecture notes and notability) rather than having to press between pages would be nice as well as it would be quicker to check past lines of works when doing long equations and such. Add these two features (preferably as one time pay features seeing as they feel like key features to every other good writing app) and this review would instantly be changed to five stars.

The pdf annotator needs lots of work. Highlighting can't lock into a straight line, text entry/annotation is clumsy, changing between colours is time consuming. Not at all practical for the amount of annotating I need to do on my documents. I honestly can't understand how making a decent pdf annotat...Full ReviewThe pdf annotator needs lots of work. Highlighting can't lock into a straight line, text entry/annotation is clumsy, changing between colours is time consuming. Not at all practical for the amount of annotating I need to do on my documents. I honestly can't understand how making a decent pdf annotator is so hard. Cancelling my subscription. Am close to giving up on finding a decent pdf annotator for Android. The developers of this app should check out GoodNotes for ipad, which I would give a solid four stars.

I'm rating it a 4 so hopefully the devs are more likely to see my suggestions. If anybody finds this to be in bad taste, I will change it to a 5 star to reflect my actual opinion of the app. First a quick review. This app is fantastic. I use it for taking notes in university. I use it to jot down vi...Full ReviewI'm rating it a 4 so hopefully the devs are more likely to see my suggestions. If anybody finds this to be in bad taste, I will change it to a 5 star to reflect my actual opinion of the app. First a quick review. This app is fantastic. I use it for taking notes in university. I use it to jot down video game ideas. I use it to doodle when I'm not paying attention to a lecture.  The free version is everything you need to take sufficient notes although I've payed for a few tools to enhance the experience; well worth it. If i had ONE wish, it would be that notes would have tags and be searchable by the tags so that we could search for notes by the content. Titles just aren't enough for me to remember everything the notes contain.   Adding compatibility with multi-window on galaxy tablets would be awesome too so that I could read a pdf textbook and take notes simultaneously. Anyway, thanks for saving me from wasting paper and pencils and erasers. Keep up the good work.

Good writing app The only thing lacking is an input filter to smooth the strokes. I notice a very ugly ripple on the strokes and words when I zoom in a bit. Otherwise, the app is very nice. Very adequate Notebook app After struggling with the slow and clumsy S-Note, Papyrus is a relief, offering the basics needed to make notes and sketches quickly, without having to spend much time choosing and tweaking pen settings, etc. I especially appreciate the availability of standard paper sizes and grids that reproduce t...Full ReviewAfter struggling with the slow and clumsy S-Note, Papyrus is a relief, offering the basics needed to make notes and sketches quickly, without having to spend much time choosing and tweaking pen settings, etc. I especially appreciate the availability of standard paper sizes and grids that reproduce to exact scale in a PDF. The small cost of the tool pack to add shapes, text, highlights etc is well worth the cost. Interface and organization is simple and most importantly, fast. Thanks.

Best note taking app I have used S-note, Evernote and OneNote. This app is better than all of them.   Key features are: endless scrolling, many different line and grid options, unlimited color selections.   The most surprising and useful feature is the ability to use your finger to erase.   The only features I wish were...Full ReviewI have used S-note, Evernote and OneNote. This app is better than all of them.   Key features are: endless scrolling, many different line and grid options, unlimited color selections.   The most surprising and useful feature is the ability to use your finger to erase.   The only features I wish were available is the ability to set a few predefined stroke widths and colors. This would make color coding notes easier. A more robust text tool would be nice too.

In fact the last couple times it crashed , it then immediately asked me to rate it. Ironic? Second , it can't sync. So if you have it on your phone and your tablet yo...Full ReviewI actually love squid. I'm only giving it a 3 because of a couple issues. First, it crashes often and you can lose some of your work. In fact the last couple times it crashed , it then immediately asked me to rate it. Ironic? Second , it can't sync. So if you have it on your phone and your tablet you can't update notes across the two. It does have a backup function to Dropbox which is at least some comfort. Third , I wish it integrated better with Windows so I could edit and better work with my notes from my laptop. Otherwise , it's simple and personal. I originally looked at lecture notes , but it was way too complicated for what I was looking for. For simple handwriting notes and PDFs. It's great. I highly recommend it to corporate trainers , because you can put all your lesson materials in it and you don't have to lug around a big program binder.

Great little app & helpful / communicative developer.  Been using the Premium (though NON subscription) version of this app for about 8 months now.  It's generally been great!  The only things that have been a little tedious is that the Cloud based sync using Box can be a little on the slow side whe...Full ReviewGreat little app & helpful / communicative developer.  Been using the Premium (though NON subscription) version of this app for about 8 months now.  It's generally been great!  The only things that have been a little tedious is that the Cloud based sync using Box can be a little on the slow side when you have an increasing number of files .   Also when you have a large ongoing ("infinity") sized document, strolling can be a little on the slower side as the document when fully sized & takes a few moments to get reconfigured / repopulate with each swipe. With the kind of docs I create, that can delay things when editing & looking for a section.  Some people have expressed concern about the subscription model being 'enforced' on them. Personally I don't have a problem with developers going subscription & would have upgraded to it if it offered more features than simply a few paper styles that I didn't really have a need for or if I didn't already purchase all the Premium add ons.  But as I purchased all the Premium add ons separately last year (which I believe is / was still an option now ), I didn't yet see the value in going subscription. Time will tell if this changes.

Lastly i would like a print view or a preview of a normal paper boundary, like if I wanted to write only within the bounds of an 8.5x11 paper. Other than that it is great.

In fact they've posted a long article online trying to rationalize their feeling of entitlement... It reminds me of McDonalds workers who complain that they can't raise a family on the salary they're being paid.  Save yourself the coin and frustration and just buy Lecture Notes. I wish more features came free but at least the purchases are one-time. This app is also awesome on a Surface.

Random Closing Glitch Becoming a Problem UPDATE: Since upgrading my tablet, I have had zero problems with this app. Using it to take notes in class has made it possible for me to succeed in college.  I really liked the idea of being able to write with my finger on a tablet, as I have a condition that makes gripping a pencil very difficult....Full ReviewUPDATE: Since upgrading my tablet, I have had zero problems with this app. Using it to take notes in class has made it possible for me to succeed in college.  I really liked the idea of being able to write with my finger on a tablet, as I have a condition that makes gripping a pencil very difficult. However, Papyrus randomly closes the note I'm working on and returns to the home screen without saving my work. I lose work, sometimes a lot. An auto-save feature would be nice, so the note would save itself every certain number of minutes. They should fix this random closing issue. It's making me want to find another notetaking program.  Also, when .pdfs are exported, small objects like periods get lost in the process. When working on math problems, decimals are always omitted during .pdf export.

But am I missing something, or is it not possible to scroll vertically through PDF pages in Edit Mode?  When I switch to View Only mode, I can scroll as expected.  It seems that in Edit Mode, there is no "tool" for scrolling pages (ie. when zoomed with my tablet in landscape orientation)?  So it seems that I have to switch back and forth every time I want to make a mark and then scroll to another page (yeah, I see the prev/next page arrows, but I want to scroll while zoomed, tablet in landscape with keyboard).  Please tell me I am missing something, because every one of these *ing PDF apps is the same: for every awesome feature, it's missing some kind of stupidly simple functionality or UX feature...

The option to turn on/off the pressure sensitivity for Samsung S-Pen is helpful if yo...Full ReviewFantastic app.  I was disappointed to see the removal of the former app Papyrus but the features of the revised app are definite improvements.  A must for any Samsung Note device.  PDF support is a great addition.  The option to turn on/off the pressure sensitivity for Samsung S-Pen is helpful if you find the pressure sensitivity of the Note 5 an issue.  I was able to take a few pictures of products on my Note 5, bring the pictures into a note then draw a few comments on the pictures and type / write some additional comments, PDF the entire note and email (or text it) to a few people.  It may not have the organizational abilities of OneNote or Evernote, but it writes smoothly on Note devices and you can incorporate pictures and PDFs into an endless paper where you cannot do this as easily in other apps.

Update 12/15/2015: Since I use this for work, a functioning backup is critical. Unfortunately, the automatic backup and pdf functions ("premium" features for which I have paid) no longer work once you have accumulated a decent number of notes. Several fixes to this problem have been suggested by use...Full ReviewUpdate 12/15/2015: Since I use this for work, a functioning backup is critical. Unfortunately, the automatic backup and pdf functions ("premium" features for which I have paid) no longer work once you have accumulated a decent number of notes. Several fixes to this problem have been suggested by users on the Squid feedback website - such as incremental backups - but there is no indication of a plan to implement any solution.  So, if you just want to use it for a few doodles, it's great. But if you actually want something that you can count on, look somewhere else until they fix this issue.   Original: Still needs a few features to be added, but they seem to be pretty responsive to user input - so I expect to see those things implemented eventually.

Awesome but lacks key features This is a great app that works like a charm. I use it to keep charts to manage my diabetes, for notes at client locations and for lists. I have two of the three paid plugins and wow, they are great.  The thing is, there is no way to duplicate documents. In other words, no Save As feature, and this i...Full ReviewThis is a great app that works like a charm. I use it to keep charts to manage my diabetes, for notes at client locations and for lists. I have two of the three paid plugins and wow, they are great.  The thing is, there is no way to duplicate documents. In other words, no Save As feature, and this is a killer. I do hope they add it soon. Another thing that is really needed is access to the same docs over multiple devices. I understand this second feature is a lot to ask for, but sometimes I have one device but not the other and not being able to get at my stuff harshes my app buzz. I will definitely recommend this to others. If you have a tablet with a pen, this is the app you've been waiting for.

I'm half way through my Electrical Engineering degree, and I take all of my notes on this app, and then export them for the rest of the class to use.  Feature Requests: 1) Google Drive integration.   - I maintain all of my class documents through Google Drive, and right now I have to manually export each note to drive.  Along that same theme....  2) Export Notebooks/Batch export - as it is right now I have to open the note, open the menu and export for every single note.  I really wish I could long press on a note/notes and export, as well as being able to long press on a notebook title and export.  3) Sub-notebook/folder organization -as I said, I use this for all my classes, which means I have a notebook for each class, but I've subdivided them further into notes folders for each class, homework folders for each class, as well as personal projects, to do lists, grocery list, sketches, etc....  I really really really need subfolders or a filebrowser and just have them organized on my flashcard/google drive.  4) Quick symbol drop down 5)LaTeX interpreter/math drop down menu.  would pay for plugin

Other handwritting Apps each have their strenghts and weaknesses, but for me Squi...Full ReviewI have tried several handwritting note apps, and Squid ((formerly Papyrus) is the best out of the bunch.   I like Squid better then the in-built S-Note. (If you are using Note 8, you can download the improve S-Note).   Other handwritting Apps each have their strenghts and weaknesses, but for me Squid  stands out from the best. I    hope they do improve the software. For instance, I like INKredible which wins out on the smoothness of its handwritting and the background template.       Wishlist:   1. Page template e.,g. Diary Template (similar to INKredible)  2. Ability to copy from Samsung clipboard (ie. to select from web site and paste)  3. Smooth handwritting  4. Tool Pallette easily available rather then going into a sub-menu. 5. I choose the A4 papersize. However, when you zoom-in-out. It changes  your choose papersize from A4 to infinite, which is very naughty. 6. I can't insert a page before page one. 8. Everything I add a new page, I have to keep changing the page setting e.g. size to A4 and blank page. Why can't it default to what I want?. 9. Add image, give you lots of ways to add an image, but wish there was a dedicated 'add image from camera'.

Squid is perfect when you need paper and don't ...Full ReviewThis app is a minimalist alternative to apps like Evernote or OneNote. Sometimes you just want to write something down quickly without navigating through multiple screens, logging into an account or generating a unique format document like a checklist. Squid is perfect when you need paper and don't have any but you have your smart phone. Its interface is sexy and highly intuitive. I've been looking for something like this for a while. Papyrus came close but it wasn't as sleek and the pages were hard to keep sized correctly. This redesign, complete with the coolest logo ever, make me smile. I hope Squid doesn't try to compete with other note apps by adding more and more distracting features over time. This app is worth way more than it's premium package price in its current state.
This is wonderful I can talk to a client on my phone and scrawl notes/annotate stuff here and it keeps it all filed for me. Can't believe I had a tablet pc for a year & didn't use this!

Papyrus' Change I originally bought Papyrus. Twice...it crashed and erased EVERYTHING in my folders. I didn't complain. I just re-downloaded all of it. Now...the name has changed and it requires me to buy AGAIN to have PDF access. Once more...I have lost everything! No more!!!!

Great. Still needs better page browser You can't see more than one page from the notebook browser, so if you keep lots of pages in a note, vs los of individual note, this month be problematic. I personally like fewer notes,more pages.
A little jumpy When I swipe (move) around the screen, it tends to jump, or snap back to the previous view. The best example is that the page is almost on a rubber band. Great function otherwise.

I do love the app, it's great for note taking and sketching. My only gripe is since the name change and update it's ditched the premium features I purchased in app. Ever wish you hadn't deleted those confirmation emails...

Good but needs more features, would recommend The basic work flow is great. It's simple and quick to use and I would recommend it especially for anyone with a galaxy note device. It would be great if there was an integrated sound recorder. 4. An option to type stuff like Microsoft one note would be nice. Like the ability to do bullets and numbered lists. I've tried restarting my tablet and everything. For an app that I've spent money on, this should not be happening. Please fix it soon :( reinstalling the app fixed the issue, but I lost all my notes because box backup wasn't working.

Solid app This is my second semester using this app. It's okay. It struggles with pdf documents that are over 30 pages long and causes the app to crash. The app crashes too often as it is. It struggles with pdf documents that are over 30 pages long and causes the app to crash. The app crashes too often as it is. I like being able to export my notes to my google drive. Improvements that need to be made is to let you import other file formats such as power points and word documents for editing. Not just pdf files. There should also be a feature where the screen shifts for you when you get to the end of the screen when you write with a stylus.  Notability carries these features for ipad users. Squid/papyrus needs to do the same so it can keep up.

Great App.Much better than Samsung Note. But I'm Afraid there are some Simple but bad problems.  1)You can't save your note files anywhere!Unless export them!And when you export them you can't change them any more!  2)You can't make file in the app.So abstraction is out of picture.  3)The in-app pur...Full ReviewGreat App.Much better than Samsung Note. But I'm Afraid there are some Simple but bad problems.  1)You can't save your note files anywhere!Unless export them!And when you export them you can't change them any more!  2)You can't make file in the app.So abstraction is out of picture.  3)The in-app purchases are a little bit expensive.  4)You can't do the Continuous rolling on your notes! (As you could easily use width-fit and write your notes.)  At the end I have to say it's a great app, but there are some easy to solve problems that we hope the developers would pay attention to them in their future updates.  At the end I suggest this app. to all the Galaxy note users!

Almost Perfect! Background: I came from IOS on an ipad mini and iphone, this app replaced Notability... Almost.   The Good: Drawing features are excellent. Love the touch sensitivity built into the stylus of the note. Differentiating stylus input from finger input is so great. I can draw with the stylus, and if nee...Full ReviewBackground: I came from IOS on an ipad mini and iphone, this app replaced Notability... Almost.   The Good: Drawing features are excellent. Love the touch sensitivity built into the stylus of the note. Differentiating stylus input from finger input is so great. I can draw with the stylus, and if needed, zoom in with my fingers, draw a marquee around an object it with my finger to select it, and then scale, copy, move or delete with no tool chagning. I bought all the add-on's after the free trial period without even hesitating. They're all  extremely useful. Although, to be fair, a little expensive. In most cases, it's easy to manipulate images from other apps through sharing and/or opening into squid/papyrus.    The Bad: Editing text... aweful. Some bugginess on the widgets loosing their names in a folder for shortcuts and infinite screen size creates issues where the screen stops recognizing finger inputs at the system level, not application level. The backup features NEEDS to be able to use the same file on multiple devices.   I would replace this with notibility if I could for the improved text, backup, and cloud features.

I've been using this app for quite a while now. This app is indeed a great one but also has it's flaws. It would be wonderful if this...Full ReviewI've been using this app for quite a while now. This app is indeed a great one but also has it's flaws. For some reason, writing with the S-pen does not seem to be as smooth with some other apps like Onenote, even though the general experience is much better with Squid. It would be wonderful if this was worked on for an upcoming update. Furthermore, it would be an added plus to have margins included to the ruled lines for the page types. This would make it look more like a notebook, and I think make it more welcoming to new users (my own opinion). An option to save to Google Drive would also be welcome. Great app. Well done guys.

For example using my spen I can easily grab part of my screen,  but to put it into a note I first have to save it as a bitmap file and the...Full ReviewI would like it to work more easily with text,  being able to copy text and edit it in my notes. I would also like an easier way to copy pictures into my notes.  For example using my spen I can easily grab part of my screen,  but to put it into a note I first have to save it as a bitmap file and then import it into squid. Finally,  there should be an option to post-process the images captured by the camera in the way that camera scanner does. The contrast is increased so that the text of the picture of a paper note has maximum visibility on the screen.

It did the job it was supposed to. It wasn't perfect- the toolbar is really crampt and you can't edit page order- but it did it's job. Recently, this app has been screwing up. It keeps crashing and when I open the note again all of it's contents are deleted. This has now happened 3 times, but because I've invested so much money in the in app purchases (which are overpriced considering they're standard features in similar apps) I feel like I have to keep using it. Hopefully they fix everything and make it worth my money, but since nothing (besides the name) has changed in the two years I've been using it, I highly doubt it.

I guess it is really complicated because of the format, but it would be nice to  do all the editing directly on PDF format, with "real time" cloud-save, such as in some PDF editors. In this way the experience would be seamless and I wouldn't have to worry with redundant copies on PDF, old PDF and the backup. Also only being able to select a square shape is sometimes annoying.

Ok I wish you could scroll between pages instead of clicking arrows. This is the only drawback. Everything else is very good, better than lecturenotes, and it imports PDF really fast too.  but this scrolling thing alone is a deal breaker.

I'm also very impressed with the handwriting -- it looks smooth and accurately r...Full ReviewI use this to take notes on pdf slides using my Samsung Note 10.1 (2014).  Unlike S note, the pdf feature correctly imports all LaTeX math correctly (dropping minus signs and Greek letters at random is not acceptable!). I'm also very impressed with the handwriting -- it looks smooth and accurately reflects my paper-and-pencil handwriting. The Dropbox integration ensures I have access to all of my notes on every device. I tested several note-taking programs before choosing Papyrus and found I always missed the "finger swipe to erase" function.  I will happily pay for the pdf and Dropbox features when my free trial is over.  This app is excellent!

Unreliable for serious note takers I like it. It has some nice features, but I've lost data twice. This app needs a "save" button. I don't want to export a note as a pdf every time I make changes. It has some nice features, but I've lost data twice. This app needs a "save" button. I don't want to export a note as a pdf every time I make changes. It won't let me save the pdf to internal storage or the sd card. It will only let me share the pdf to another app. I don't always have time to backup my notes to Dropbox. It should behave more like any office software. When I create a note it should ask me to give it a file name and choose a save location. I take a lot of notes.  It really sucks when I open a note and find that dozens of pages worth of notes have disappeared.

In my view, two features would really make it stand out: First, it is odd that, when reading pdfs, the zoom settings change each time you turn a page. Great, with some flaws This app is really useful and has some great features that I have put to use while note-taking and studying. However, there is an issue with the responsiveness of the touchscreen that occurs intermittently on my tablet, where it will stop recognizing my finger when I try to erase strokes. I have dea...Full ReviewThis app is really useful and has some great features that I have put to use while note-taking and studying. However, there is an issue with the responsiveness of the touchscreen that occurs intermittently on my tablet, where it will stop recognizing my finger when I try to erase strokes. I have dealt with this by turning off and back on the display, which will fix the problem for a while. I have also noticed that the S Pen will occasionally write things about a centimeter away from the point where the pen is applied on-screen. I'm not sure if these problems are due to my tablet or the application, but other than that, this app is highly recommendable.   One suggestion for future development could be to include a feature where automatic syncing to the cloud is done only to files that have been updated/ written on since the last synchronization (instead of uploading all files to the cloud each time).

Customization is good, but not yet at 100%, even with premium features.

And so, I would love to give this app a 5-star review if it weren't for one *very* glaring oversight: the lack of any ability to share into the Papyrus app itself from other apps. Not perfect, but best out there Has a combo of features that are surprisingly difficult to find - highlight and take notes on the document, then save as the original document on my device so I don't have to go looking for it. What could be improved?  It needs an easier way to zoom the pages, like a default zoom level you can selec...Full ReviewHas a combo of features that are surprisingly difficult to find - highlight and take notes on the document, then save as the original document on my device so I don't have to go looking for it. What could be improved?  It needs an easier way to zoom the pages, like a default zoom level you can select for the document. Also, the default edit setting shouldn't be a writing tool. I should have to select when I want a screen press to write something. Default should be one-finger moves the page. It needs a quick page select feature at the bottom of the screen as well as a little indicator telling me I'm on page x of xx. Lastly, an intelligent highlight assist is needed - other apps sense the line of text and keep you on it, while Papyrus essentially has a draw function requiring impeccable accuracy to highlight.

I have researched pen, handwriting, traditional tablet PCs, in grad school before touch...Full ReviewAnyone that gives this less than 5 stars is either uninformed or unreasonable. It's vector graphics - there are limitations which the app provides for. Sure there might be bugs but such is the nature of software. I have researched pen, handwriting, traditional tablet PCs, in grad school before touch screen devices were ubiquitous. This app addresses the limitations we had back then! It's downright amazing! Check out the folks at SBIM if you want to see how much difficult hard work went into this app. Props!

However, I don't use this app for taking notes in school because it lacks the ability to automatically save notes to a PDF file (you can manually import a PDF, edit it, then export it as a PDF, but you can't use it to just open a PDF and save yo...Full ReviewThis app works flawlessly with my Samsung Galaxy Note. However, I don't use this app for taking notes in school because it lacks the ability to automatically save notes to a PDF file (you can manually import a PDF, edit it, then export it as a PDF, but you can't use it to just open a PDF and save your edits the PDF file). If you're looking for an app that lets you take notes directly on a PDF, then sync the annotated PDF with your computer, check out the free Adobe Reader app. I will update this review if they add that functionality in a future release.

Perfect for architecting/planning/brainstorming This app is simple yet powerful. The infinite page size (which I'm still almost infinitely less than using completely) let's me not stop mid thought to add a page or move text over. The lasso (copy/paste) tool is scarily good at moving only what I want (gets entire shapes/letters without bordering s...Full ReviewThis app is simple yet powerful. The infinite page size (which I'm still almost infinitely less than using completely) let's me not stop mid thought to add a page or move text over. The lasso (copy/paste) tool is scarily good at moving only what I want (gets entire shapes/letters without bordering shapes/letters or cutting in half), and for resizing. I'm assuming it uses vectors but whatever it is makes resizing selections stay just as clear and sharp. And unlike other apps it doesn't have any pause between drawing and seeing it on the screen. I used lecture notes before this and loved it except for the speed (even using all the tweaks the author suggested). And I didn't know infinite page size was a possibility. The only thing I can think of wanting is more shapes, like an arrow. But that's easy to just draw and copy/paste.

A requirement for handwriting notes for Sales!!! Pens *with complete erasing/undo*, highlighters, and boxes/circles/other ways to pull attention to specific areas on note.  I love being able to si...Full ReviewNot only are notes concise and just like on paper *I used Levenger systems primarily before*, I can do way more without bringing more writing utencils.  Pens *with complete erasing/undo*, highlighters, and boxes/circles/other ways to pull attention to specific areas on note.  I love being able to sign pdfs and email them without having to print/sign/scan, or add picture of signature manually. Lost hundreds of dollars, almost died. DO NOT USE FOR CRITICAL DATA. On the other hand the app is kind of cool, and fun, and probably good for data that's not actually critical.  This app lost me hundreds of dollars, and, except for my keenness of mind, could have ended in the death of myself. I used this app for mission-critical, real-time note-taking for medication...Full ReviewOn the other hand the app is kind of cool, and fun, and probably good for data that's not actually critical.  This app lost me hundreds of dollars, and, except for my keenness of mind, could have ended in the death of myself. I used this app for mission-critical, real-time note-taking for medication and dosage management, since it was the only one with support for the stylus on the Note 3 and skeumorphic paper. The app glitched and deleted three days worth of notes (which are lists of numbers for me, including times and dosages), and replaced them with no warning with notes from three days ago. If I had trusted the app and not had the intuition that 'these numbers are wrong', harm could have resulted. LESSON: NEVER USE NON-CERTIFIED 'CONSUMER'-GRADE TRASH FOR MISSION-CRITICAL APPLICATIONS.  Negative ten, and the first review I have ever posted -- and ever intend to. I've never had an app that nearly let me die before. It's like a anaesthesia timer that counts two minutes per minute.

Ok This app basically has every feature I need/want for taking notes in my lectures, but it has one severe drawback: the writing is NOT smooth if you are not zoomed in enough. There are so many features that I LOVE about this app. It is easy to take pictures of slides, crop them and insert them into my...Full ReviewThis app basically has every feature I need/want for taking notes in my lectures, but it has one severe drawback: the writing is NOT smooth if you are not zoomed in enough. There are so many features that I LOVE about this app. It is easy to take pictures of slides, crop them and insert them into my notes. It's really easy to erase, zoom in and out, scroll. You can import PDFs and write your notes on them directly. The app is robust and easy to use, but my writing has all these squiggly lines at the beginning and end of my letters and I'm really, really tired of it. Papyrus is the best note taking app for lectures, but these squiggly lines have had me searching for a replacement for months.

Great note taking app I use it for doing math problems and just love how easy it is to use. I like how I can create different notebooks for different subjects having all my notes in a neat and organized manner. Last thing is I like how they quickly fix the tegra 2 crash on startup issue.

Genius I bulk installed around 10 similar apps looking for something like this. Nothing offers such a well design app for note taking. This is the only one left installed. Operation is learnt in about 5 mins.  No nonsense design means you can open new or add to existing organised notes or notebooks with ve...Full ReviewI bulk installed around 10 similar apps looking for something like this. Nothing offers such a well design app for note taking. This is the only one left installed. Operation is learnt in about 5 mins.  No nonsense design means you can open new or add to existing organised notes or notebooks with very few selections.  I'm using it in the context of an IT support department so I need to get going in the time it takes to pick the phone up and say 'hello'.  Writing tools are easily changable as you go with 'extras' little more than the cost of a similar paper notepad. Editing facilities are excellent with erasing / box drag select sections.  When done notes can be sent to the cloud in a couple of taps to access from anywhere to whoever selected.

Closest thing to Notability I love Notability on the iPad. This is the closest app I have found to it. It needs a few more things to measure up but it is a very good app. Probably the best Android note taking and pdf annotating app I have found.

Smooth app, but still has some flaws I tried about a dozen note taking apps before I settled on Papyrus. However, for it to  be a 5-star app, I think it needs the following features: rearrange, delete, & insert page...Full ReviewI tried about a dozen note taking apps before I settled on Papyrus. It's very smooth, decent UI, and since I use it for work, I like that it doesn't automatically upload notes to the cloud. However, for it to  be a 5-star app, I think it needs the following features: rearrange, delete, & insert pages; sub folders for notebooks; and export an entire notebook at once without having to export to the cloud.

Good but needs 1 more thing I am a general contractor and I use Papyrus to keep all my daily log notes, meeting minutes, markup PDF's, and sketch up fixes in the feild. My work-around on this is that I leave a little extra room on my meeting minutes so I can jot down notes during the meetings.

Great app for PDF-markup and general notes (handwriting) This is an excellent app - in that it provides good features and executes them beautifully. Features = import bookmarks and annotate them in all ways; make free-form notes and notebooks; export all kinds of note-documents into PDF;  Save; and then Share them via email or adding to Dropbox.   The fea...Full ReviewThis is an excellent app - in that it provides good features and executes them beautifully. Features = import bookmarks and annotate them in all ways; make free-form notes and notebooks; export all kinds of note-documents into PDF;  Save; and then Share them via email or adding to Dropbox.   The feature I feel is missing is "automatic syncing to Dropbox" -- I find it so many times that I want to access my docs somewhere, and have not explicitly Exported them. There needs to be a way to control this feature - basically, I want to designate a document to be always sync'd to Dropbox by default. That is, the "Save" command should function as Sync. Also, it should remember where in my Dropbox folder structure the document should go.

Good, but missing some crucial features This is the most versatile note taking app on the market. Great features. However it does not include two features possessed by it's rival "Write" These are 1) Ability to create handwritten  bookmarks in the document    2) Ability to reflow text. That means add space in between of paragraphs easily ...Full ReviewThis is the most versatile note taking app on the market. Great features. However it does not include two features possessed by it's rival "Write" These are 1) Ability to create handwritten  bookmarks in the document    2) Ability to reflow text. That means add space in between of paragraphs easily to add more  information later. These two features are so crucial that most students  switch to "Write"  even though it has limited capabilities.

Probably the Best Note Taking App on Android Very useful app, vector grahics and the note book system comebined with a fair amount of settings make this app very easy to use and enjoyable to use. It...Full ReviewVery useful app, vector grahics and the note book system comebined with a fair amount of settings make this app very easy to use and enjoyable to use. However, it lacks the ability to choose where you save your notes, this forces you to use up your internal storage, even when you pay for the App! It has also caused some weird glitchs for me, but a quick restart seemed to resolve them. Very good, but there is a lot of room for improvement.

A Student's Best Friend I use this app for all my engineering lecture notes, homework assignments, and back-of-napkin calculations on my Galaxy Note II and my Galaxy Note 10.1. The ability to import and write directly on a PDF, the shape tools, and highlig...Full ReviewI use this app for all my engineering lecture notes, homework assignments, and back-of-napkin calculations on my Galaxy Note II and my Galaxy Note 10.1. I export and email PDFs of all three every day for work and school. The ability to import and write directly on a PDF, the shape tools, and highlighter tools are a must. I'm just mildly annoyed they nickel and dime you for those. I'm also mildly annoyed you can't delete or rearrange pages. That would make this a five star app.

I started with Papyrus before they had PDF annotation and have purchased each of the premium packages (not cheap by Play store standards).  Each release lead to Papyrus becoming a better note taking tool.  Most recent updates seem to ignore most commonly requested user items according to their feature request website.  Instead the development team focused on Presentation mode and Chromecast support?  Unfortunately, there is low availability of quality note taking/PDF annotation apps for Android, but Papyrus is among the best.

Top handwriting app I use this for all my lecture notes and research scribble. PDF import/export doesn't destroy links or text. I use it for signing my signature to forms and adding light notes to PDFs, but more commonly use ebookdroid for reading them. This is a constantly improving app, but it's worth the money right now if you do a lot of writing.  Until it reaches some kind of final form, expect a kind of a la carte approach to the biggest features. There are many free updates, though it doesn't seem that handwriting recognition is coming any time soon.

Almost It's a good note taking app and the second best on the market. It falls way short on the drawing tools and the ability to save custom pens. I'm in college and use lecturenotes because the custom tools and ability to save pens makes taking notes in class a breeze. It also lacks the ability lecture ha...Full ReviewIt's a good note taking app and the second best on the market. It falls way short on the drawing tools and the ability to save custom pens. I'm in college and use lecturenotes because the custom tools and ability to save pens makes taking notes in class a breeze. It also lacks the ability lecture has with organization (keywords, indexing, and search) it's almost there, but needs some fine tuning. A really good app though and I did pay for all the additional features. If you need a basic note taking app and don't require a lot of extras or intense organization this is the one for you. I do like the actual flow of writing in this app better than lecture, but without the other features I have to place this as a backup.

its pretty decent if all you want is handwriting with a pen but the only thing that its better then the notes that comes with the galaxy note is that its more "fit to screen" (something you can really adjust actually in the notes, but it looks nice), the ability to select the text and edit it (increase\decrease size, change colors, etc.), more comfortable editin...Full Reviewthe only thing that its better then the notes that comes with the galaxy note is that its more "fit to screen" (something you can really adjust actually in the notes, but it looks nice), the ability to select the text and edit it (increase\decrease size, change colors, etc.), more comfortable editing tools location. but thats it! it DOES NOT support the gestures of excess to those tools like it promises!!! and the text editing tools are limited (no outline or bold text options), but you can change the location of the text, and change its color and size, which can be nice. for conclusion: its really bad for a company to promise something and not come through, which i would have deducted 2 stars for it, but the convenience of taking notes is pretty good, and if  they had the option of hand write detection (meaning detect what you write in your own hand write and  convert it to text) would have been a great achievement for 5 stars all it need is to  fix their promise with the gestures (which is come through or remove the idea), to add more text editing tools, and add some kind of text reading algorithm (or just buy it from someone and add it to their app). other then that its nice

It works really nicely, has great tools, copy and paste, undo, eraser, easy to use, and somehow doesn't seem to get confused when I rest my hand on my tablet while writing.  It even has a setting to disable the back button within the app, which is great for me since I tend to press it by accident when resting my hand. It also syncs to dropbox.  A couple things do cost extra, but it's well worth it.

Lots to like but missing some important functionality Nice app but has functionality limitations that make it a no-go for me: * The toolbar isn't permanently visible, so it takes several clicks to switch between the various tools. Gets really clunky when you need to switch regularly. * No scroll by swiping, and no continuous page display  * Page naviga...Full ReviewNice app but has functionality limitations that make it a no-go for me: * The toolbar isn't permanently visible, so it takes several clicks to switch between the various tools. Gets really clunky when you need to switch regularly. * No scroll by swiping, and no continuous page display  * Page navigation is done by either hitting the forward or back key , or pressing the page number and spinning through all the pages - takes forever on a large document  * Phone app freezes on large PDFs  *Zoom level doesn't hold when you change pages  * Pasting text from other apps doesn't wrap the text - just sticks it in as one long line Lecturenotes has a bigger learning curve but provides all of this and lots more, so I've adopted that as may primary note taking app.

Papyrus I've tried a lot of note taking apps and this is the best for me. A nice clean, uncluttered interface and good, useful functionality. A nice clean, uncluttered interface and good, useful functionality. One of the things that is important to me is the ability to easily annotate PDFs. Papyrus is the way to go--it does cost extra for that and several other tools I want, but for the ability to do something I really need to do it is well worth it. I didn't think I would use the 'add-image' function, but it turns out to be very handy and again easy to use. Thanks.

Must have for S-pen note-taking Papyrus is the closest thing to pencil and paper available for an S-pen tablet. In settings, check the box that says that you have an S-pen device. Without the toolkit you can erase with your finger, but only full strokes...

Fantastic, flexible app operates as paper, notebook, and ebook Having now tried pretty much every 3+ star rated handwritten note-style app in the marketplace, I can confidently say that this is the best one by a LONG shot.  To be clear, I use a Galaxy Note 10.1 - and with that form factor in mind (i.e., an active pen), it's fantastic for note taking.  It also w...Full ReviewHaving now tried pretty much every 3+ star rated handwritten note-style app in the marketplace, I can confidently say that this is the best one by a LONG shot.  To be clear, I use a Galaxy Note 10.1 - and with that form factor in mind (i.e., an active pen), it's fantastic for note taking.  It also works very well as an ebook - provided you load them in as PDFs.  It could use some features to round out its usability - but I mean this in the sense of MS Office needing improvements, not NeoOffice - that is to say: the tool is complete as is and very good, but obviously it's not perfect.  If you're looking for an all-purpose handwriting app, I HIGHLY recommend getting it.
